StringTable.Language:
Grunt Heavy Grunt Heavies deal heavy damage to vehicles using their Fuel Rod Cannons, but have low hitpoints. Sniper Marine Marines wielding Sniper Rifles to kill enemy units at range. The Sniper Rifle is only most effective against Infantry Units. Gauss Warthog Fast assault recon vehicle equipped with a powerful Gauss Cannon. Needler Elite Two Elites that use Needlers to decimate enemy infantry. Spec Ops Elite Elite that drops from orbit to get behind enemy lines. Grunt Deacon An inspiration to all grunts, deacons are the highest ranking grunts in the Covenant. Shade Turret Shade Turrets are stationary turrets that can be placed anywhere on the battlefield to defend a location. Grunt Armor Improved armor allows Grunt Heavies to sustain more damage. Incendiary Grenades Grunt Heavies gain the ability to throw incendiary grenades, which explode on impact and burn the affected area. Grunt Shielding Grunt Heavies gain protective shields that absorb incoming damage. Needler Grunts Cannon fodder infantry units that use Needlers to kill infantry. Peons Needler Grunt squads have one additional Grunt. SuperCombine Needles will occasionally cause a large explosion that will deal area damage. Heavy Needler Needlers are upgraded to Heavy Needlers, which deal more damage. Personal Shield Needler Elites gain shields that absorb incoming damage. SuperCombine Needles will occasionally cause a large explosion that will deal area damage. Heavy Needler Needlers are upgraded to Heavy Needlers, which deal more damage.
Cicada Cicadas are well-rounded light vehicles that provide decent damage at a long range. Armor Upgrade I Cicadas armor durability is increased. Armor Upgrade II6 Cicadas armor durability is increased. Shield Upgrade Cicadas gain a shield that absorbs incoming damage. Elite Ranger Upgrade 1
Jump Pack Ability Grants the Elite Rangers a Jump Pack, allowing them to cross impassible terrain. Beam Rifle Upgrades the Elite Rangers Carbines to Beam Rifles Elite Ranger Elite Marksmen that use Carbines, and can be upgraded to use jump packs and Beam Rifles. Rocket Marine A Marine wielding a Rocket Launcher to destroy enemy Vehicles. These Marines are most effective against Vehicles. Marine Armor I Rocket Marines survivability is increased. Smart Rockets Rockets gain tracking when attacking air units. Marine Armor II Rocket Marines survivability is increased.
Plasma Grenade Ability Grunts gain the ablity to throw Plasma Grenades. Peons 2 Grunts are added to the squad. Grunt Shields Grunts gain rechargable energy shields that absorb incoming damage, increasing the survivabilty of the squad. BR Marine UNSC Marine Squad equipped with Battle Rifles. These Marines deal slighlty more damage than Assault Rifle Marines and have a slighlty farther attack range. Methane Refinery Produces Resources faster than a Warehouse. Jackal Needler Jackal
Jackal Sniper Squad A Jackal Sniper accompanied by two Needler Jackals. Jackal/Grunt Squad An Elite-led squad consisting of Jackals and Grunts. Rocket Warthog Fast assault recon vehicle equipped with a powerful Rocket Turret. Flame Warthog Fast assault recon vehicle equipped with an Anti-Infantry Flame Thrower turret. Shotgun Marine Close-Ranged infantry that wield Shotguns to deal heavy damage at close range. Frag Grenades Shotgun Marines can throw Frag Grenades. Flashbangs Shotgun Marines can throw Flashbang grenades. Rapid Fire Shotgun Marines can rapidly fire at enemies. Sniper Armor I Sniper Marines gain more hitpoints and damage. Sniper Armor II Sniper Marines gain more hitpoints and damage. Sniper Armor III Sniper Marines gain more hitpoints and damage. Spartan Barracks Trains UNSC Spartan Super-Soldiers. Heavy Needler The Grunt Deacons Needlers deal Area of Effect damage. Advanced Tactics The Grunt Deacons can garrison Spirits and Towers. Fuel Rod Cannons The Grunt Deacons trade in their Needlers for Fuel Rod Cannons. Shade turrets The Grunt Deacon can build Covenant Shade Turrets. Sniper Towers The Grunt Deacon can build Covenant Sniper Towers. Mega Turret The Grunt Deacon can build Covenant Mega Turrets. Land Mine A small mine that explodes after enemies get too close or after being attacked. Jackal Squad Jackal infantry lead by a Brute. Jackals are fragile, so they use a shield to deflect incoming damage while rapidly firing plasma at their enemies. These Jackals also overcharge their plasma pistols to deal extra damage and to temporarily stun vehicles. Skirmisher Commando Utilizing the powerful Needle Rifle, Skirmisher Commandos are highly skilled infantry that specialize at killing infantry at a distance. Spartan Foresight Spartan enhancements allow all regular class Spartans to dodge incoming projectiles. This upgrade will increase their survival rate on the battlefield. Neural Implant Improved reflexes allow all regular class Spartans to Jack enemy Vehicles much more effectively, greatly improving their Jack speed. Passive Grenade Throw This upgrade will equip Spartans with Grenades. All regular class Spartans will now occasionally throw grenades at the enemy if researched. Rhino The Plasma Rhino is an Artillery Unit that can Lockdown to fire at a much greater distance. When locked down, the Rhino continuously fires at a designated location. The Lockdown Attack deals damage to friendly units, so keep your units out of its line of fire. Lockdown Capability Rhinos gain the ability to lockdown, allowing them to attack from a greater distance. Reinforced Plating An additional set of composite alloy plates boost the Rhinos damage mediation. Health and Damage Upgrade Infantry: Increases Health and Damage. Warthog: Adds a Grenadier in the passenger seat. Rapid Fire Ability Infantry: Forge can quickly fire his Shotgun. Warthog: Upgrades Machine Gun turret to a Gauss Cannon. Dodge Infantry: Forge can dodge incoming projectiles. Warthog: Gains the ability to fire an Anvil Round that deals heavy damage and stuns enemy units. Stun Bullets Anders bullets stun vehicles. Repair Kit Anders can repair vehicles. Building Repair Anders repair rate is increased and she can repair buildings. Anders "I know it's been a tough call, Captain, but it's the right one." Anders is a professor in the UNSC, assigned to the Spirit of Fire. She can be upgraded to stun enemy vehicles and repair friendly vehicles and buildings with the proper upgrades. ODST Drop Unlock Unlocks the ability of the classic hotdrop; ODST units may be deployed anywhere on the battlefield. The Power takes up Slot 3 on the Power Wheel. This was only available to Captain Cutter, until new battle orders states to use what ever it takes to take the fight back to the Covenant! Upgrades for these ODST may be found in the Field of Armory. RPG Ability In addition to Cutter's ODST Drop's passive grenade throw, they'll now have an RPG ability, including New Mombasa ODST. All ODST Hitpoints and Damage is increased. ODST New Blood Cutter's ODST Drop squads gain an ODST wielding a Battle Rifle. All ODST Hitpoints and Damage is increased furtherly. ODST New Blood II Cutter's ODST Drop squads gain an ODST wielding an Assault Rifle. All ODST's Hitpoints and Damage is increased one final time. Combat Medic Marine Combat Medic that heals nearby friendly infantry units and can deploy a stationary Medic Beacon that heals nearby units. Brute Heavy Brute Heavies deal heavy damage to vehicles using their Fuel Rod Cannons, but have low hitpoints. Brute Heavy Upgrade 1
Incendiary Grenades Brute Heavies occasionally throw incendiary grenades at infantry, which explode on impact and burn the affected area. Jump Pack Ability Brute Heavies are promoted to Heavy Jump Pack Brutes, allowing them to cross impassable terrain Fuel Rod Wraith Powerful mainline battle tank that is outfitted with duel Fuel Rod launchers to destroy enemies at range. Heavy Shield Adds an energy shield that deflects some incoming damage. Volley Ability Fuel Rod Wraiths gain the active volley ability. Anti-Air Capabilities Fuel Rod Wraiths projectiles are upgraded to track enemy air units. This will drastically improve their effectiveness against air units. Elite Heavy Elite Heavies deal heavy damage to vehicles using their Fuel Rod Cannons, but have low hitpoints. Elite Heavy Upgrade 1
Incendiary Grenades Elite Heavies gain the ability to throw incendiary grenades, which explode on impact and burn the affected area. Personal Shield Elite Heavy's gain shields that absorb incoming damage. Warthog Ram Flame Warthogs gain the ability to ram enemy units. Grenadier Adds a Marine armed with a Flame Grenade Launcher to improve attack strength. Oxide tank An advanced, higher burn point fuel increases damage to all organic units. Warthog Ram Rocket Warthogs gain the ability to ram enemy units. Grenadier Adds a Marine armed with a Grenade Launcher to improve attack strength. High Impact Rockets Rockets deal increased damaged. Warthog Ram Gauss Warthogs gain the ability to ram enemy units. Grenadier Adds a Marine armed with a Grenade Launcher to improve attack strength. High Powered Cannons Improves the Gauss Warthogs cannon to fire more powerful blasts. Warthogs Menu Use this option to allow the Vehicle Depot to produce a wide selection of Warthogs. Flame Warthogs, Guass Warthogs, Rocket Warthogs, Double Barrel Warthogs, Special Rocket Warthogs, and even speedy Scout Warthogs may be trained here. Main Vehicles Head back to the default Vehicle Depot menu, allowing you to train Scorpions, Cobras, and Wolverines along with their upgrades. Plasma Grenade Ability Elites and Grunts can throw Plasma Grenades and Jackals can fire overcharged plasma blasts to stun enemy vehicles. Jackal Reinforcement Another Jackal is added to the squad to increase combat capability. Jackals gain defensive shields to deflect incoming damage. Grunt Reinforcements Two more Grunts are added to the squad to increase damage output. Jackal shields are improved so they wont collapse from taking damage. Defense Gauntlet All Jackals in the squad recieve a defensive shield to deflect incoming damage. Beam Rifle Jackal Snipers replace their Carbines with Beam Rifles to kill enemy infantry at a greater range, and Needler Jackals needles occasionally cause large explosions that deal area damage. Supreme Gauntlet Jackal shields are upgraded so they wont collapse when taking damage. Alternate Barracks Menu Transfer to the second menu of the Barracks to train other varients of Marines. Marine Scouts, Battle Rifle Marines, Light Marine Squads, Marine Commandos, New Mombasa Jetback ODST, and Marine Assault Squads may all be trained here. Main Barracks Transfer back to the Main Barracks menu, which allows you to train various types of Marines along with Upgrades to research. Spartan 69 - Jones Jones weilds a Spartan Laser, a weapon powerful at long range and effective against vehicles. He is also the leader of Red Team. Dodge Jones gains the ability to dodge enemy projectiles. Neural Implant Improved reflexes allow Jones to Hijack enemy vehicles much more effectively. Grenade Ability Jones gains the ability to throw grenades at enemy units. Watchtower Watchtowers have one function, to provide the base with a large line of sight. They can be upgraded to turrets. Watchtower Upgrades the turret to a watchtower, providing the base with a much larger line of sight. Plasma Overcharge Jackals gain the ability to overcharge their plasma pistols to deal more damage. Defense Gauntlet Jackals gain deflective shields that absorb incoming damage. Jackal Support Jackal Squads gain a 3rd Jackal to increase damage output. Spec-Ops Elite Drop Drops an Elite anywhere on the battlefield. Requires Spec-Ops Elite Upgrade Skirmisher Agility Skirmisher Commandos agility allow them to constantly dodge projectiles. Needle Rifle Skirmisher Commandos are now equipped with Needle Rifles. Personal Shield Skirmisher Commandos gain shields that absorb incoming damage. The Combat Pelican is armed with an AC-220 Vulture Cannon. It can defend itself while delivering troops where you command. Spirits are capable of transporting both infantry and vehicles across the battlefield. Reinforcements I Adds +10 to the population cap of your army. Reinforcements II Adds +10 to the population cap of your army. Reinforcements III Adds +10 to the population cap of your army. Reinforcements IV Adds +10 to the population cap of your army. Followers I Adds +10 to the population cap of your army. Followers II Adds +10 to the population cap of your army. Followers III Adds +10 to the population cap of your army. Followers IV Adds +10 to the population cap of your army. Bomb Grunt An unfortunate Grunt that carries a large bomb that will explode when near enemy units. Sprint Ability Bomb Grunts gain the ability to sprint towards enemy units. Corrosive Bombs When detonated, bombs will leave behind a burning chemical on enemies. Land Mine Place a land mine that will explode when in close proximity to enemy units. Caution: Friendly units wont detonate the mine, but will be damaged by its explosion. Incendiary Mine Upgrade this land mine to inflict fire damage on enemy infantry units when detonated. EMP Mine Upgrade this land mine to stun enemy vehicles when detonated. Corrosive Mine Upgrade this land mine to inflict corrosive damage on enemy vehicles when detonated. Spirit Spirits are used by the Covenant to transport infantry and vehicles to any location on the map. Increased Carrying Capacity Increases the carrying capacity of Spirits from 6 population to 12 population. Increased Carrying Capacity Increases the carrying capacity of Spirits from 12 population to 18 population. Grunt Horde A large, cheap squad of Grunts that will provide great returns per cost in combat. Grunt Ultra Grunt Hordes gain a Grunt Ultra. Ultras are significantly better than Grunt Minors, and inspire them. This will improve the Grunt Squads overall combat effectiveness. Purchasing this upgrade will increase the carrying capacity of all UNSC Pelicans by 6. This will upgrade the Pelicans again, increaseing it furtherly to 18 population. Increased Carrying Capacity Increases the carrying capacity of Spirits from 12 population to 18 population. Spartan - SMG Prototype UNSC super soldiesr that duel wield SMGs. They are well rounded, but are more effective against Infantry. Spartan - Minigun Prototype UNSC super soldiers that wield a minigun. They are somewhat well rounded, but are most suited against Infantry. Spartan - Rocket Prototype UNSC super soldiers that wield a SPNKR Rocket Launcher. They are good against Infantry and air units, thanks to splash damage and tracking, but are not as effective against heavy vehicles. Spartan - Laser Prototype UNSC super soldiers that wield a Spartan Laser. They are good against vehicles and decent against infantry, but are not suited well against air units. Spartan - Shotgun Prototype UNSC super soldiers that wield a Shotgun. They are not effective against vehicles and air units, but make up for that in effectiveness against Infantry. Spartan - Grenade Launcher Prototype UNSC super soldiers that wield a Grenade Launcher. They cant attack air units, and have low accuracy, but deal high damage. Spartan - Battle Rifle Prototype UNSC super soldiers that wield a Battle Rifle. They are most effective against infantry units. Drone Lightly armored infantry that use Plasma Pistols against enemy units from above the battlefield. Needler Drone Lightly armored infantry that use Needlers against enemy units from above the battlefield. Plasma Rifle Drone Lightly armored infantry that use Plasma Rifles against enemy units from above the battlefield. Summit Page 2 Transfer to the Second page of the Summit. Summit Page 1 Transfer to the First page of the Summit. Drone Upgrade 1 Adds another Drone to the unit. Drone Upgrade 2 Increase health and damage. Drone Upgrade 3 Adds another Drone to the unit. Needler Drone Upgrade 1 Adds another Needler Drone to the unit. Needler Drone Upgrade 2 Increase health and damage. Needler Drone Upgrade 3 Adds another Needler Drone to the unit. Plasma Rifle Drone Upgrade 1 Adds another Plasma Rifle Drone to the unit. Plasma Rifle Drone Upgrade 2 Increase health and damage. Plasma Rifle Drone Upgrade 3 Adds another Plasma Rifle Drone to the unit. Jump Pack Brute Brutes carrying Brute Shots that have the ability to cross impassable terrain using jump packs. Skirmisher A group of Skirmisher Minors wielding Plasma Pistols. Needler Skirmisher A group of Skirmisher Minors wielding Needlers. Hall Page 2 Transfer to the second page of the Hall. Hall Page 1 Transfer to the first page of the Hall. Plasma Overcharge Skirmishers can overcharge their Plasma Pistols to fire an EMP blast. Skirmisher Agility Skirmishers agility allow them to constantly dodge projectiles. Skirmisher Upgrade 3 Skirmisher Hitpoints and damage are increased. SuperCombine Needles will occasionally cause a large explosion, dealing area damage. Skirmisher Agility Needler Skirmishers agility allow them to constantly dodge projectiles. Needler Skirmisher Upgrade 3 Needler Skirmisher Hitpoints and damage are increased. The Great Journey Gain access to Forerunner buildings and structures. Prophet of Truth
Prophet of Mercy
Evasive Maneuvers Banshees gain the ability to dodge incoming projectiles. Heavy Jump Pack Brute Brutes carrying Fuel Rod Cannons that have the ability to cross impassable terrain using jump packs. Garrisonable Mega Turret Upgrade this Mega Turret to garrison 1 squad of infantry. Also increases hitpoints. Forges Warthog Gives Forge his warthog, allowing him to travel around the map more quickly. Heavy Scorpion Heavy Scorpions are modified Scorpions that are slower, but are more durable and deal more damage. Heavy Scorpion Upgrade 1
Canister Shell Ability Equips Scorpions with a secondary Canister Shell attack. This attack is devastating to any infantry in its blast area. Flame Mortar Upgrades the Heavy Scorpions Machine Gun turret to a Flame Mortar. Medic Beacon This beacon will heal nearby friendly units. Forges Warthog Warthog with Forge on the turret. Begins with only a Machine Gun turret, but can be upgraded. Sun Devil Sun Devils are heavy tanks that use a high-rate-of-fire turret to decimate enemy Air Units. This fast-firing anti-aircraft tank is an alternative to Wolverines, and can deal decent damage. Grunt Tank A Grunt-designed vehicle that is best used against infantry and air units. Main Vehicle Heavy Shield Adds an energy shield that deflects some incoming damage. Grunt Tank Upgrade 2 Grunt Tanks' hitpoints and damage are increased. Grunt Tank Upgrade 3 Grunt Tanks' hitpoints and damage are increased. Shotgun ODST An ODST carrying a shotgun... duh. Rocket ODST An ODST carrying like a Rocket Launcher and stuff. Brute Warlord Some homie carrying a gravity hammer to smash fools. Power Turret Doubles the rotation speed for Sun Devil turrets, making them considerably more responsive in combat. Large Turret Sun Devils' turrets are upgraded to deal more damage. Marine Grenadier Marine Grenadiers are good against Air units, and also decent against Vehicles. They can be upgraded to throw fire grenades to burn the enemy; most effective to Infantry units. Marine Grenadier Upgrade 1
Stun Grenades Marine Grenadiers gain the ability to fire stun grenades at enemy units. Larger Blast Area Marine Grenadiers' grenades have a great area of effect.
____________________________Rebels____________________________ Heavy Elephant Slower, more heavily armored Elephant variant that can transport infantry units across the battlefield. Their MG Turrets can be upgraded to Gauss Cannons. Rebel Infantry Standard Rebel infantry that are good at most everything. Rebel BR Infantry Insurrectionist infantry that can deal more damage from a slightly greater distance than the standard infantry. Rebel Rocket Infantry Specialized Rebel infantry that use Rocket Launchers to destroy enemy vehicles. Rebel Shotgun Infantry Rebel infantry that deal high damage at a short distance with shotguns. Rebel MG Infantry Heavy Infantry that carries a Machinegun Turret. They are decent at taking out most everything, but are best at killing infantry. Barracks Page 1 Transfer to the First page of the Barracks. Barracks Page 2 Transfer to the Second page of the Barracks. Civilian Militia Cobra MK2 Cobra MK2's are the upgraded version of the Cobra. This unit is most effective against Vehicles. Missile Turret Cobra MK2's are now outfitted with twin Missile Turrets on the side of the Cobra MK2. This can allow the Vehicle to deal more damage to enemy units, and have a form of defense against Air Units. Steel Plating This upgrade will give the Cobra MK2 hardened Steel Plates to increase protection. This can help protect the Vehicle from incoming damage. Rebel Armor I Rocket Infantry gain increased survivability. Smart Rockets Rockets gain tracking when attacking air units. Rebel Armor II Rocket Infantry gain increased survivability. Sniper Armor I Rebel Snipers armor is improved, giving them more hitpoints. Sniper Armor II Rebel Snipers armor is improved, giving them more hitpoints. Sniper Armor III Rebel Snipers armor is improved, giving them more hitpoints. New Blood Adds another Rebel to the squad. This increases the combat effectiveness of the squad. RPG Ability Infantry active Grenade Ability upgraded to active Rocket Ability. Rockets can attack from a longer range than Grenades. New Blood II Adds another Rebel to the squad. This increases the combat effectiveness of the squad. Rebel Armor I Rocket MG Infantry defense and damage increased. Rebel Armor II Rocket MG Infantry defense and damage increased. Rebel Armor III Rocket MG Infantry defense and damage increased. Sniper Armor I Rebel Sniper defense and damage is increased. Sniper Armor II Rebel Sniper defense and damage is increased. Sniper Armor III Rebel Sniper defense and damage is increased. Rebel Commander A leader among Insurrectionist forces that wields a Grenade Launcher. Stun Grenades The Rebel Commander's Grenade Launcher is upgraded to stun enemy units. Larger Blast Area The Rebel Commanders Grenades have a greater area of impact. Tri-Shot Grenade Launcher The Rebel Commanders Grenade Launcher is upgraded to fire 3 Grenades at a time. Gauss Cannons Heavy Elephants' MG Turrets are upgraded to Gauss Cannons, which deal much more damage to enemy units.

Flood Air Vehicle 1 Infected Air Units hitpoints and damage are increased. Flood Air Vehicle 2 Infected Air Units hitpoints and damage are increased.
Flood Building Beacon Mark a location on the battlefield. This will allow Flood buildings to be constructed here.
Flood Colony Colonies are small Flood bases. They are able to build pure flood units. Flood Colony Expansion 1 Expands the Colony by adding 2 build sites and 4 Flood Root sites. Flood Colony Expansion 2 Expands the Colony by adding 2 build sites. Flood Air Vehicle 3 Infected Air Units hitpoints and damage are increased.
Infection Form Upgrade 1 Increases the number of Infection Forms from 3-6. Infection Form Upgrade 2 Increases the number of Infection Forms from 6-9. Infection Form Upgrade 3 Increases the health of Infection Forms. Infected Marine

Flood Swarm A swarm of pure Flood forms from the shield world. Thrasher Form A large pure Flood form from the shield world that uses its strength to defeat enemies, tossing them around with ease. Infection Forms A cluster of Infection Forms whose main goal is to infect enemy infantry units. Spore Cloud A cloud of Flood Spores that infect enemy units. Bomber Form Creates and drops Flood Eggs on the battlefield, which burst to release Infection Forms. These Infection Forms will die after a certain amount of time. Combat Form Upgrade 1

Flood Proto Gravemind The Proto Gravemind can train Infected Flood units, rather than pure Flood units. Small Flood Colony Use this to construct a new Small Flood Colony. Medium Flood Colony Upgrades base to a Medium Flood Colony, which adds two building sites. Large Flood Colony Upgrades base to a Large Flood Colony, which adds two building sites. Infected Flamethrower
Flood Root A Root that attacks nearby enemy units. Flood Egg A small Flood Egg that spawns infection forms when killed and can be upgraded to a large egg. Large eggs can spawn either infection forms or spore clouds when killed.

No text yet Requires ODST upgrade Global Rally Point All newly trained units will move to this location when training is completed. You can set a Base Rally Point to direct a specific bases units someplace else. Support Power A new support power is available to select Researching by other player Repair Repair or reinforce the selected units JAMMED! Eject Tell any units you have garrisoned in this cover object to get out and return to normal combat mode. Lock Units train as normal, but are garrisoned inside the base instead of exiting into the world. UNLOCK will release all the garrisoned units at once. Station Upgrades base to a Station, which adds two more building sites. Each building adds to the strength of the central structure. Fortress Upgrades base to a Fortress, which adds two more building sites. Each building adds to the strength of the central structure.
Heavy Supply Pad Supply production massively increased for this Supply Pad. Advanced Reactor This Reactor provides enough energy to match the output of two Reactors.
Defense Turrets Adds a light auto-cannon to all Elephants. This turret is only operable when the Elephant is deployed. New Blood Adds another Marine to the squad. This increases the combat effectiveness of the squad. It will also upgrade Battle Rifle Marines, having another Marine to the squad and their combat effectiveness. RPG Ability Marine's active Grenade Ability is upgraded to a active Rocket Ability. Rockets can attack from a longer range than Grenades. Battle Rifle Marines will also be furtherly upgraded to do the same.
Gunner Adds a turret attack to the Warthogs, giving them combat capability. Grenadier Adds a Marine armed with a Grenade Launcher to improve attack strength. WOLVERINE 1 Improves Wolverine damage and defense (for now). Volley Ability Enables the active Volley Ability on Wolverines. The Volley Ability can be used to deal big damage to any ground target. SCORPION 1 Improves Scorpion damage and defense (for now). Canister Shell Ability Equips Scorpions, Heavy Scorpions, and Mjolnir Scorpions with a secondary Canister Shell attack. This attack is devastating to any infantry in its blast area.
HORNET 1 Improves Hornet damage and defense. Wingmen Adds a couple of Marines riding shotgun to augment damage capabilities. Hawk 1 Improves Hawk damage and defense. Hawk 2 Improves Hawk damage and defense. Medic Adds a Combat Medic to the squad. The Medic heals the squad after combat. Also unlocks the standalone Combat Medic, who heals nearby friendly infantry unit. This will do all the same for the Battle Rifle Marines. COBRA 1 Improves Cobra damage and defense (for now). Deflection Plating Hardened steel plates give the Cobra extra protection when locked down. Fort Turret upgrade
GRIZZLY 2 Increases Grizzly damage and defense. GRIZZLY 3 Increases Grizzly damage and defense. LEADER UPGRADE 1 Increases the attack and defense of your Leader. Medium Turret Upgrades all Turrets to Medium Turrets, increasing their hitpoints and damage. Large Turret Upgrades all Turrets to Large Turrets, increasing their hitpoints and damage. Medium Turret Upgrades all Turrets to Medium Turrets, increasing their hitpoints and damage. Large Turret Upgrades all Turrets to Large Turrets, increasing their hitpoints and damage.
Keep Upgrades base to a Keep, which adds two building sites. Citadel Upgrades base to a Citadel, which adds two building sites.
Peons I Grunt squads have one additional Grunt. Grunt Squad Upgrade 2 Grunt squads hitpoints and damage are increased. Defense Gauntlet Adds extra shielding to deflect incoming projectiles. Beam Rifle Jackals are now equipped with particle beam rifles. Bonded Shield Equips each Hunter with a huge shield that can deflect many projectiles. Spirit Bond Hunters get a big damage boost while both bond brothers are alive. Boosted Ram Ability Enables the Boosted Ram Ability on Ghosts, allowing them to effectively ram their targets. Strafe Allows Ghosts to more effectively dodge incoming grenades and rockets. Boost Enables Speed Boost Ability. Repeating Cannon Increases the rate of fire for the Banshees weapons. Vampire 1 Shadow tech for Vampire Stasis Drain Stasis Ability now drains target hitpoints and heals the Vampire. Heavy Shield Adds an energy shield that deflects some incoming damage. Scorch Ability Enables the Scorch Ability that superheats an area of terrain for extra damage. Reserves Train times for all units are drastically reduced.
Adrenaline Booster shots enable all infantry units to run at significantly increased speeds.
Improved Machine Gun Upgrades Warthog machine gun. Improves damage and defense. Supplies to Energy Trade Supplies for Energy Request organics Trade Supplies for organics Energy to Supplies Trade Energy for Supplies Sacrifice organics Trade organics for Supplies Dual Launchers An extra rocket pod gives Wolverines considerably more damage potential. Power Turret Doubles the rotation speed for Scorpion turrets, making them considerably more responsive in combat.
Chaff Pod Hornets gain the passive Chaff Ability that is used to distract and divert incoming missiles. Hawk 3 Improves Hawk damage and defense Piercing Shot Cobra railguns gain extra power to allow them to punch through multiple targets, inflicting damage on each. Shade Plasma Modifies Turret into an anti-infantry shade Turret. Heavy Needler Modifies Turret into an anti-air heavy needler Turret. Plasma Mortar Modifies Turret into an anti-ground vehicle Turret. Locust 1 Shadow tech for Locust Overdrive Ability Enables the Locust Overdrive Ability. This ability uses the Locusts shield generator output to overcharge its beam weapon. Attack power is drastically increased at the expense of the Locusts shields. Grunt Ultra Grunt squads gain a Grunt Ultra. Ultras are significantly better than Grunt Minors and inspire them. This will improve the Grunt Squads overall combat effectiveness. Big Monument Bigger Monuments are worth more Blessed Warehouse Upgrade the production capacity of this Warehouse to produce more supplies. Leader 2 Increases the attack and defense of your Leader. Leader 3 Increases the attack and defense of your Leader. Flame Mortar Adds bonus Anti-Infantry attack to the Turret. Rail Gun Adds bonus Anti-Vehicle attack to the Turret. Missile Launcher Adds bonus Anti-Air attack to the Turret. Reinforcements Adds +10 to the population cap of your army. AutoCannons Adds front-firing 35mm guns, improving the Choppers attack. Stabilizers Improves autocannon accuracy and damage. BRUTE 1 Shadow tech for Brutes Jump Pack Ability Brute Captains are promoted to Jump Pack Brutes, allowing them to cross impassable terrain. Followers Increases the maximum size of your army by 10.
Marine Marines are the main UNSC infantry unit. They are good against most everything. They have an active Grenade Ability that can eventually be upgraded to an active Rocket Ability.
Needler Grunts Mainline troop, slow and short range, yet still the best returns per cost in combat.
ODST ODSTs are an elite version of UNSC Marines. They excel at everything a Marine is good at, but can also be hot-dropped anywhere on the battlefield from Spirit of Fire. Spartan Prototype UNSC super soldiers, the Spartans possess extreme combat skills. Spartans have an active ability to Jack enemy vehicles and Commandeer friendly vehicles. This boosts the combat power of those vehicles. Warthog Warthogs are the UNSCs fast scout units. They start with an active Ram Ability, but can be upgraded to get various guns for extra attack power.
Scorpion Scorpions are the main UNSC vehicle. They can stand toe-to-toe with the toughest enemies, but are mobile enough to get where theyre needed quickly. Wolverine Anti-air missile pods cover the UNSC Wolverines shell. Devastatingly effective against air units, Wolverines can also unleash a fusillade of rockets against buildings. Plasma Rhino The Plasma Rhino is a secret UNSC weapon just now entering field tests. Unpacking the Rhino turns it into a long-range artillery unit that fires heated plasma, decimating anything it hits.
Hawk The Hawk is a upgraded hornet that upgrades it in many ways. Vulture Vultures are the most advanced UNSC war machine. Costly to produce, the Vultures dish out damage at an alarming rate. Shortsword
Grunt Squad Mainline troop, slow and short range yet still the best returns per cost in combat. Suicide Grunts
SPEC-OP Elites Specialty troops, wielding energy swords and using cloaks these units are best tearing infantry apart from surprise.
Elite
Brute Captain Specialized, heavy infantry with powerful Brute Shots, these squads dish out lots of damage. Jackal Sniper Counter-infantry unit, often armed with sniper rifles, Jackals can make quick work of enemy infantry. Hunter Heavy counter-vehicle units wielding powerful fuel rod cannons, Hunters are a credible threat even against tanks. Arbiter Leader of the Covenant forces, the Arbiter is equipped with dual plasma swords for uber-melee death.
Wraith Mainline battle tank, good speed and excellent range combine to make this a powerful ground vehicle. Ghost Fast assault recon unit. Scarab The Covenant Super Unit. These massive assault vehicles have a devastating beam that can tear apart virtually anything.
Banshee Mainline air unit, Banshees are armed with both plasma cannons and fuel rod cannons. Arbiters Banshees do not have the Sacrifice ability, but instead can be upgraded to dodge incoming projectiles. Vampire Counter-air aircraft, heavy needler turret can track and engage enemy air in a large area. Flamethrower Pyromaniacs to the core, UNSC Flamethrowers burn up any organic thing they can find. They excel at killing all infantry units. Locust Counter-building vehicle, very slow and best set to destroying unprotected enemy bases. Cobra The UNSC Cobra is an incredibly effective anti-vehicle threat. Its fast and agile against vehicles, but also has an active Unpack Ability that turns the Cobra into a long-range artillery unit that is excellent against buildings.
Elite Honor Guard Specialty troops that guard the Prophet. These stealthy infantry wield powerful plasma swords capable of shredding any target. Grizzly The UNSC Grizzly is a beefed-up version of the Scorpion. The Grizzly is even better at killing everything than the Scorpion, and starts with dual cannons and the ability to fire canister shells. Brute Chopper Fast assault recon unit. SUICIDE BOMBERS

Global Rally Point All new units will move to this location when their training is complete. The Global Rally Point overrides existing Base Rally Points. Reactor UNSC Reactors provide the energy needed to access advanced buildings, units and technology upgrades. High-tech bases may have as many as 4 or 5 Reactors. Warehouse The Covenant Warehouse produces the resources needed to train units, build buildings, and buy technology upgrades. Bases that have great economic production might have 6 Warehouses. Supply Pad The UNSC Supply Pad produces the resources needed to train units, build buildings, and buy technology upgrades. Bases that have great economic production might have 6 Supply Pads. Heavy Supply Pad The UNSC Heavy Supply Pad produces extra resources (compared to the default Supply Pad) needed to train units, build buildings, and buy technology upgrades. Bases that have great economic production might have 6 Supply Pads. Advanced Reactor UNSC Advanced Reactors provide twice as much energy (compared to default Reactors) needed to access advanced buildings, units and technology upgrades. High-tech bases may have as many as 4 or 5 Reactors. Fuel Rod Turret Anti-vehicle Turret Needler Turret Ant-air Turret Watch Tower
Flame Mortar Turret Anti-infantry Turret Field Armory The UNSC Field Armory is a combination machine shop and high-tech laboratory. Many advanced technology upgrades can be found here. Exit
Barracks The Barracks trains the bulk of the UNSC Infantry units. Infantry technology upgrades can also be found here. Vehicle Depot The UNSC Vehicle Depot constructs the ground vehicles for the UNSC army. Vehicle technology upgrades can also be found here. Air Pad The Air Pad creates the various UNSC air units. Air unit technology upgrades can also be found here.

Prophet Of Regret Leader of the Covenant forces, the Prophet of Regret also brings unique combat abilities to the battlefield. In addition to his combat strength, he can call down the Cleansing Power to incinerate his enemies. Prophet Prophet description Sergeant Forge must try to help scattered groups of pinned-down soldiers and retake Alpha Base. With the area around Alpha Base secure, the base must be brought back online. Military units must then be trained and sent to investigate the relic. Anders and Forge have been cut off inside the structure. They must be rescued. The Covenant has attacked Arcadia in force, and the civilian population is evacuating. Spirit of Fire's ground troops will provide cover. Covenant forces have overrun the city. Spirit of Fire's troops must fall back and hold a defensive position until Omega Team arrives. The Covenant have constructed a large energy dome on Arcadia. Enemy forces must be defeated and the dome destroyed. The dome was protecting a Covenant super weapon. Ground units must be sent in to finish the job. Readings from the planet's surface are highly unusual. The advance forces must be covered and protected while they investigate. Anders' transponder signal has been detected. She must be found and rescued before it is too late. Get Charlie Platoon to the Landing Zone Mysterious alien infection forms threaten Spirit of Fire. They must be cleansed from the ship's hull before they penetrate the interior. A Covenant destroyer has sideswiped Spirit of Fire. The ship must be repaired and Covenant forces must be driven back. It is vital that Anders returns to Spirit of Fire. She must be protected and escorted to the LZ. The shield world must not fall into Covenant hands. Spirit's reactor core has been removed and will be used to destroy the entire facility. The reactor core must be brought to the Apex. At the same time, a way for Spirit of Fire to escape must be found. UNSC Forces are falling back from the Covenant invasion on Harvest, while others are scattered. The Covenant also built a base where Alpha Base once stood with a massive army stationed to hold off from any UNSC attackers. Forge arriving on scene will help. Train an army to fight back the Covenant forces in the region to retake Alpha Base. After taking back Alpha Base, it's time to start building. Covenant Forces have been ordered to wipe out all UNSC Forces in the area, and have been preparing while you were attacking Alpha Base. With the full Covenant armada in the region, pushing forward is your only option. Cornered and outnumbered, get Alpha Base up and running and find out what the Covenant are up to. Alpha Base was rebuilt and taken back. After reaching the Relic Interior; Forge and Anders fell for an unexpecting trap and are pinned down inside the Relic. Build a new outpost near the entrance and rescue them at all cost. The Covenant invasion of Arcadia is in full swing. Evacuation of its civilian population is the UNSC's top priority. Grizzly Tanks from the previous rescue mission and additional troops will aid in clearing out the city. You'll greatly slow the attack on Arcadia if you can take full control of the area while safely evacing the Civilians. The civilian evacuation is complete. UNSC forces must safely withdraw from the city. Forge and the rest of the UNSC Forces successfully evacuated Crator and linked up with Professor Anders to uncover what the Covenant were after on Arcadia. The Covenant has built a base ahead to stop the UNSC from advancing; you'll need to hold off from deadly attacks using the Super Fortress and destroy the base ahead to be able to progress with the initial plan of attack and using the help of Anders. Send in ground units to destroy a Covenant super weapon. Forge and Recon Groups ECHO and INDIA start the search for Anders while building up a small UNSC outpost to push through the large amount of Covenant forces ahead. UNSC Forces are being met with heavy resistance from the Flood monsters in the area, unable to reach Ander's Beacon. All Allied forces are retreating to the base, only now realizing the dangers ahead when it's too late for them. The Super Fortress is under a devestating assault from the Flood as well; it's clear they don't want you in the area. Defend your base, push through the mighty army of The Flood and find Anders and rescue her before it is too late. Optional: send Gremlin to the Pylon Cleanse the infection forms from Spirit's hull before they penetrate the interior. Repair Spirit of Fire and drive Covenant forces back. Protect Anders and escort her to the LZ. Pull the reactor core to the Apex site. Help Spirit of Fire's crew escape from the Shield World.

Destroy the Covenant Base and its Guards Evac Time Remaining: Red Team? Three platoons inbound. Designating them Alpha, Bravo and Charlie. They're with Charlie, sir... that could be a problem. We can't evac those trapped Marines until the air is clear. Let's be about it, people. Missile detected inbound! OK! I'm on my way. Sorry, I can't help you right now. Give me a minute then I will help you. Look what the enemy is doing... there. Can you help me defend... here? Can you help me attack... here? I want to claim this node. Sergeant, Alpha Base won't be able to respond in time. We've got Grizzlies inbound from Spirit of Fire. Hold on down there... Ah, Grizzly Tanks - Forge's pet project. Good work! Get me to the east bridge's control panel. I think I can get it activated. Watch that six, we're moving out! Give me a minute and I'll get this bridge operational. Hmm, no manual? No problem. Getting there... Got it, the bridge is operational. You heard the lady; let's give her some privacy. Secure the Area by Killing all Covenant in the Crater EDIT Well this little field trip is a bust. Anders, is there anything out here except for that huge alien dome thing? Platoon recovered, enroute to the Spirit. Spirit, evac forces requesting a repair on the base.
I think I can reactivate those bridge controls. Watch those doors - looks like company is coming! We'll clean up this mess. Omega Team, secure the sector, clear out that Covenant base! This is too easy! The Covenant are building structures to the north of our base! Scans indicate the Covenant are building a large plasma weapon. Move the CROSSHAIR toward your base. Good. A base is a collection of buildings. It starts with the Command Center... ...and several building sites. To construct your first building, press A at the building site indicated. Selecting any building site brings up the BUILDING MENU. Use the LEFT STICK LS to highlight the Supply Pad. That's it! Press A while the Supply Pad is highlighted to begin construction. Good. Unlike Crates, Supply Pads provide a steady stream of resources. It takes quite a few Supplies to make an army, so it's usually good to have more than one Supply Pad. Build another one over here. Right on. Now let's train some Marines. Marines come from a Barracks. Build a Barracks over here. Select the Barracks and train a squad of Marines. Use the LEFT STICK $$LS$$ to highlight the Marines and then press A to start the training. Your first squad of Marines has finished training! Press B to close the BUILDING MENU. Move your CROSSHAIR to the Marines. Good. All of the units you train from this base will gather here. Select the Barracks and train four more Marine squads. You can queue up more than one Marine at a time by pressing A multiple times. Great! Now that we have enough squads, let's get ready for the next phase. Press A for player options ph1 Directing allied forces to your location Setting rally point Setting rally point No allied forces available for attack Your allies cannot spare toops Allied strike force initiated Allies will rally at your base Allied forces retreating to rally point We don't have intel at that location. Sending allied scout Directing allied scout to attack zone Directing a small allied strike force to take out the target Yes sir! All allied forces ordered to attack All allied forces being sent to defend Allied forces launching attack now Dispatching allied scout. Note, your allies are low on forces 400 supplies sent. Request resources from ally? (click again for yes) Your ally is low on supplies We should hold out for a stronger attack. We don't stand a chance. Requesting you delay that order. Scout has arrived at waypoint. Charging Enemy Base! Dispatching reinforcements to turn the tide of this battle. Directing reinforcements to this area Retreat Join the Enemy Allies All right, now we'll learn how to select groups of units. Move the CROSSHAIR to the Marines. Good. Now, select that first Marine squad, but this time, press and hold A. Notice the expanding selection circle. The circle will select every unit it touches. Select all of your Marines by holding A and moving the circle with the LEFT STICK LS. Awesome. Well, those are the basics. Feel free to keep playing against the A.I. opponent. We'll give you a few more pointers as you explore. Take a look around your base. We've opened up more units and buildings for you to make. There is a red enemy base on the far side of the map. Destroy it to win. Have fun! This is an unclaimed base location. When your units are close to it, you can select it with A and construct a new base. This base has been claimed by your enemy. If you destroy it, however, you'll be able to build your own base here. Reactors are critical buildings. As you build more Reactors, new units and technologies are unlocked. Red numbers indicate that you don't have enough Reactors. Technology upgrades improve your units by making them stronger and giving them new combat abilities. You should get some armor on the battlefield. Build a Vehicle Depot and train a Scorpion Tank. You might want some aircraft. Construct an Air Pad and train a few Hornets. Your Marines need some upgrades. Research the New Blood Upgrade at the Barracks to add another Marine to each squad. Jackals! If you kill the Jackals, you can gather the Supply Crates here uncontested. At least until your opponent shows up... Grunts! Evac Pelican inbound with UNSC survivors - cover us. Kill these Grunts to make this area safer for your own units. This Forerunner artifact generates Supply Crates. There's another on the other side of the map, too. You might want to see if your opponent has found it yet. Marines and Flamethrowers can use this sniper tower for range and defense. Some units, such as Marines and Warthogs, have special combat abilities. With one of these units selected, press Y on an enemy to see the unique ability. Marines can throw grenades using Y. With only Marines selected, press Y on an enemy to see the carnage! Warthogs can ram enemies using their special ability. With only Warthogs selected, press Y on an enemy to run him over! Okay, the gloves are off. The A.I. player is now active. Get to it! Buckle up, we're goin' in! Oh boy, are you in for it... You're getting buzzed by some enemy Warthogs! Fortunately, your units will automatically attack enemies. You may also command your units to attack specific enemies by pressing X when the CROSSHAIR turns red. There are some enemy Marines over there. Follow the OBJECTIVE ARROW and send your Marines in to attack! Great work! The Hornet is your primary aircraft. It is quick and good against many things. Press A to select The Vulture is awesome. It flies, does a ton of damage and has the Barrage ability. With only Vultures selected, press $$Y$$ on an enemy to ruin their day. Flame Marines are fast and short ranged and will incinerate any infantry they attack. The ODST is a Fleet upgrade to the Marines. They work just like Marines - only better. Cobras are an anti-vehicle unit. With only Cobras selected, press Y to lockdown the Cobra for extra damage and extra range. The Elephant is a mobile Barracks. With only an Elephant selected, press Y to deploy it. Once deployed it behaves like a Barracks. The Wolverine's primary role is annihilating enemy aircraft. Turrets can defend your base against early attacks. All UNSC ground forces are supported by the Spirit of Fire orbiting above. To see the powers Spirit of Fire gives you press UP on the D-PAD $$DPAD$$. These are Spirit of Fire's powers. Some cost Supplies and Reactors, some are free. Some do damage to enemies, some heal your units. There is a limit to the number of units that you can have. The topmost number in the display near the minimap shows how close you are to that limit. This is your opponent's main base. You win! Thanks for playing the Halo Wars Alpha Tutorial! Go get into some games! To select all units on screen at once, press RB. To select all units everywhere, press LB. Halo Wars Alpha Tutorial The Halo Wars Alpha Tutorial Map Supply Crate Forerunner Supply Containers 30 Usable Supplies SELECT BACK CANCEL CHANGE OPTION Mobile Mini-Base CONFIRM Press B to auto target. Press LB to select all the units on the map. Press RB to select all the units on the screen. Press LEFT on the D-PAD to cycle between your bases. Press DOWN on the D-PAD to cycle between your armies. Press UP on the D-PAD to jump to SPIRIT OF FIRE. Many cool powers and abilities are initiated from the orbiting ship. Press RIGHT on the D-PAD to cycle through the last few notifications you've received, such as UNDER ATTACK or BUILDING COMPLETE. Press X to do a MOVE or PRIMARY ATTACK. Press Y to do the SECONDARY ATTACK or ABILITY. Holding A down will initiate a paint selection mode. This is useful for easily selecting some of the units on your screen. Double tapping A on top of a unit will instantly select all the units of that type on the screen. Use the RIGHT TRIGGER to quickly cycle between the automatic sub groups. This is useful for giving fast commands to parts of your army. Hold the LEFT TRIGGER to drastically increase the speed of your camera. Captain Cutter has a unique unit called the ELEPHANT. Mark Two Sentinels This Build-Hog can construct Bombs, Turrets, and Buildings for a high price. Being able to build anywhere, doesn't come cheap. This unit can be very useful if you are eager to expand, and have extra supplies to spend. Further information how to build with the Build-Hog properly below. (Warning!) Please do not abuse this feature, and build close to an enemies base. Be fair, and respectful of this option. (Build-Hog Instructions) To build with the Build-Hog properly, you must know a few things. The Build-Hog does not place buildings at random, the object will place the same way every time in front of your Build-Hog, and it also depends on which way the Build-Hog is facing. Pay attention to the objects rotation each time you place it, and you can create decent bases. It is also best to build on flat areas, without any uneven terrain. UNSC Watch Tower This Tower can be built anywhere you like, it can be used to see further out and units taking cover will have damage reduced. Base Turret A UNSC Sentinel. This is a useful building to train Sentinels from. Here, you can train Shield Protectors, Healing Protectors, Offensive Protectors, Sentinels, Gold Sentinels, and Super Sentinels. If you're needing to get Sentinels around, then this will provide use. This is a Special Infantry Barracks. Building this will allow you to train all sorts of unique units. Odst, Shotgunners, Snipers, Flame Throwers, Grenadiers, Cyclopses, and Arcadia Police. This building can be useful to build around a base you have elsewhere on the map. A useful UNSC Landing Pad will allow you to train special units anywhere you'd like on the battlefield. You can create Gremlins, Elephants, Cobras, Rhinos, Wolverines, Sun Devils, and Grizzlies. This expensive Landing Pad can provide use build around others bases. This Turret can be built anywhere, best around your single buildings if you decide to make a base anywhere. You can also enhance your main base defense with these. If the Turret is destroyed, you will have to create a new one. You are allowed to deploy a Tatical Turret when attacking enemy bases. This is the one build acceptable without being a cheater. If you have units attacking the base, you can command the Build-Hog to deploy and slowly build the turret during the attack. Otherwise, don't build turrets randomly in sneaky spots around enemy bases. Snipers, Flame Throwers, Shotgunners, Sniper Squads, Hell Bringers Squads, and Shotgun Squads can be trained here. This Elephant is useful if you need Anti-Infantry Units on the field. Rocket Launcher ODST Demolition Squad The Demolition Squad contains 6 soldiers. 2 Rocket ODST, 2 Rocket Marines, and 2 Marine Grenadiers. With these elite ODST and Marines, they can fire many explosives and blow the enemy to peices. Grenadier Squad Four Marines armed with Grenade Launchers make great Anti-Vehicle units. With these weapons, they will leave destruction on the battlefield. Spartan Elephant [Gauss Cannon Turrets] In this Elephant, you can train Spartans and they will be deployed from it. Depending on your choice, Spartans will wield Sub-Machine Guns, Shotguns, Grenade Launchers, Chainguns, Rocket Launchers, and Spartan Lasers.
