Random Assortment OST Fingerprints Are Broken Play Fingerprints Are Broken from the Halo Wars OST through the Sirens of the Super Fortress. Song only plays once. Almost makes the troops wonder if they're in a simulation. Flip and Sizzle Play Flip and Sizzle from the Halo Wars OST through this Siren for some peaceful tunes. Song only plays once. Arcadia Play a song from Arcadia themed maps here to play through the Sirens. Song only plays once. Flood Play a tune from Flood themed maps through this premium Siren feature to feel assertive! Song only plays once. Victory Play some victorious music from the Sirens to enspire your troops! Song only plays once. Defeat Play some sad tunes if your Super Fortress is beyond saveable, when defeat is near. Song only plays once. Victory! Play a single sound effect to enspire you and your troops. Squad of Marines Summon 6 Marines with Battle Rifles and 2 ODSTs with Rocket Launchers behind this Fence to fortify the Super Fortress. If enemies approach these Infantry units will protect the base from danger. Special Infantry Communications Tower You can build a Communications Tower at the Super Fortress for specialized Defense. The Communications Tower can request the Spirit of Fire summon Super Sentinels to defend the front of the Super Fortress, or if all previous Leader Power Upgrades have been researched, you'll be able to upgrade them a fifth time with this special Tower. Research and Defense Scorpion and Warthog Combo Command a Scorpion Tank and two Warthogs with Machine Guns to park in front of this fence to defend the Super Fortress. Grizzly and Warthog Combo Command a Grizzly Tank and two Gauss Warthogs with Gauss Cannons to park in front of this fence to defend the Super Fortress. Cobra and Gremlin Combo Command two Cobras and one Gremlin to be stationery in front of this fence for Defense. Cobras are best if put up against enemy Vehicles, as the unit itself is Anti-Vehicle. The Gremlin can be selected to use it's EMP Ability. If Vehicles are a problem then these units can certainly slow them down. Hornet and Vulture Combo Request a two Hornets and a menacing Vulture with the Hornets by it's side to hover in front of this fence for tough Defense, or to scare off the enemy. Summon Hawks Request two Hawks to hover in front of this Fence to fortify the Super Fortress, and to keep eyes in the sky. Summon Hornets Request two basic Hornets to hold the line in front of this Fence. The Vehicles will remain stationery for Defense. Gold Sentinel A flying Forerunner unit, the Golden Sentinels inflict corrosive damage with a upgraded Beam Weapon compared to the standard varient. Support Center Purchase a supportive building for the Super Fortress. This building houses upgrades to lightly increase population if the previous population upgrades in the Field of Armory have been researched. The Support Center can also be upgraded to lightly produce Supplies. Enemies can target the Support Center and destroy it if the Super Fortress's Defenses fail to stop them. All upgrades here [not including the Supply Upgrade] requires a tech level of five. Supportive Structure Transfer to the Heavy Spartan Barracks to train tough Spartans. Chaingun Spartans, Rocket Launcher Spartans, Spartan Laser Spartans, and Railgun Spartans may be trained here. Heavy Spartan Barracks Trains Heavy Spartans Trains Brave Team Members The Spartan Barracks trains the best of the best Infantry units. Spartan technology upgrades can also be found here while various Spartans and members of Brave Team may also be trained here. Clean up this pile of old concrete and remains of a small building that once stood here before the devastating attack. Alternately in it's place, you can build a Building Socket here. This Building Socket will allow you to create a Supply Pad, Heavy Supply Pad, Reactor, Field of Armory, Barracks, Spartan Barracks, Vehicle Depot, or an Airpad. Clean up this pile of rubble and metal mixed together from the tower that used to stand tall and proud here before the Covenant made a lethal assault on the Super Fortress. Cleaning up this mess will allow you to build something useful here, such as a Building Socket. This Building Socket will allow you to create a Supply Pad, Heavy Supply Pad, Reactor, Field of Armory, Barracks, Spartan Barracks, Vehicle Depot, or an Airpad. You can expand your base by building a Landing Pad here. This building will allow you to request special Vehicles. Badgers, Rhinos, Sun Devils, Wolverines, Cobras, and Gremlins. It can also transfer to a Vehicle Mark Two page which can train Grizzlies, Scorpion Tank MK2's, and Cobra MK2's or a third menu with 6 fully customized Elephants for specific combat scenarios, or two Elephants with assorted troops. All these Vehicles may be requested to be deployed by a Pelican from the Spirit of Fire. Radio Pelican The specialized Radio Pelican remains stationery, having the option to enhance your army with Leaders. Forge in his Warthog, Anders with her Magnum, Red Team with the Spartan Laser, Rocket Launcher and Chaingun combined with the Forge and Anders Team may be requested here and deployed from the Spirit of Fire for a real fight. Lower the Super Fortress's main Gate to allow troops inside to freely exit the base, or to protect the Gate from being destroyed by the Covenant. Raise the Super Fortress's main Gate to fortify the Super Fortress if the base is under an assault. Repair Fence Even some of the Fences of the Super Fortress have been damaged during the assault on the base. Having the chain-link a wreck and the frame itself destroyed, this Fence doesn't look in a useable current state. Rebuild this fence for 250 Resources to summon unique defensive units around the fence. From Infantry to Vehicles, and up to Aerial Units to defend this area from the Covenant. This Fence is only partially constructed. You can finish the construction of this Fence for the fees of 350 Resources. This Fence can provide unique Defense for the Super Fortress, allowing you to command all sorts of unit combinations consisting of various units in patterns to hold the line. Destroyed Fence Partially Constructed Fence Repair Fence Fully Construct Fence This small section of the Fence around the Super Fortress isn't finished it seems. With 100 Resources you could purchase some concrete and a small frame to fully construct this specialized Fence. This Fence in particular can command a Police Car to drive on the right of it, allowing you to request Arcadia Police to watch the outer part of the Base. Build a front gate for the Super Fortress. For the right price, you can build a operational gate at your base! The Gate can be lowered and raised, while the enemy can also target the Raised Gate and destroy it if you let them. It can also slow down the Covenant from getting inside the base until destroyed, or hold your units behind the fence. Super Fortress Gate Operational Gate Main Gate Vulture MK2 The Vulture MK2 is new to the field, even more costly to produce. As the regular Vulture is already menacing enough, this tough monster is even more devestating. Equipped with High-Powered Plasma Cannons and with a Anti-Aircraft Missle Defensive system which can freely target any units; this Vulture will terrorize anyone that stands in it's way. Deploy a Scorpion Command a Scorpion Tank to park in front of this Fence, stationery to be on guard for any hostile forces after the Super Fortress. Summon a squad of assorted Marines. 3 Marines with Assault Rifles, 2 Snipers and 2 ODSTs with a Rocket Launchers may be requested to defend the area in front of this Fence from hostile forces. Deploy Warthogs Deploy 4 Warthogs in front of this Fence for defensive measures. These four Warthogs will defend the Super Fortress from any attackers. They'll also require the Gunner upgrade or they won't have any weapon systems. Summon a large Squad of Marines all ready to defend the area. 3 Marines with Battle Rifles, 2 Marine Snipers, 2 Marines with Shotguns and even a Marine with a Rocket Launcher may be requested here behind this Fence. Grizzly and Scorpion Combo Deploy 2 Scorpions and a Grizzly in front of this Fence for stationery Defense. These Vehicles can be selected to use their Canister Shell Ability if needed, but cannot move nor take up population as they will defend the Super Fortress for you. Scorpion Grizzly Cobra and Tiger Combo Command 2 Cobras and 2 Tigers in front of this Fence to defend the Super Fortress from any Vehicular attackers. These four units themselves cannot target Air Units, and doesn't do a high amount towards Infantry; but if Vehicles are attacking your base, then this Anti-Vehicle squad may ward them off. Lower Fence Lower this Fence if troops need to exit the base and have no other way of getting out. Raise Fence Raise this Fence to fortify the Super Fortress, or to make it look good. Which ever reason suits your taste. Lowered Fence Allows Troops To Freely Exit Request 3 Hornets to hover in front of this Fence, stationery to guard the Super Fortress. These Hornets can't be controlled, nor take up population. Request 3 Hawks to hover in front of this Fence, stationery to guard the Super Fortress. A set of Hawks could slow down the enemy decently. These Hawks can't be controlled, nor take up population. Mjolnir Scorpion The Mjolnir Scorpion is a unique kind of battle tank. Unlike the regular Scorpion firing High Explosive rounds, this dangerous Vehicle fires Plasma Rounds; melting away anything it fires upon. An alternate varient of the Scorpion. Puma Pumas are hasty Anti-Vehicle units. They're tankier than a Cobra, and much faster; but not as much Damage wise. If you need some mobile Anti-Vehicle units, then Pumas are the right choice. Light Elephant [Single Long-Range Turret] This Elephant isn't like the other Elephants. The Light Elephant is the lightest Elephant known to UNSC. Faster than all the others to move around the Battlefield with haste, at the cost of it's main weapon systems. This Vehicle only has a single-barrel lockdown turret, no other forms of Defense. The Light Elephant can train Marine Scouts, Arcadia Police, Marines, Marines with Battle Rifles, Scout Warthogs, and Spartans with Battle Rifles. Sliverback The Sliverback is a fast scout unit equipped with a small duel Machine-gun attached to the top. This Vehicle isn't efficient for regular combat use; but best for scouting areas and collecting resources on the map for your Super Fortress to grow! Scout Sergeant Rusk Sergeant Rusk is an special ODST. He's equipped with a Rocket Launcher and Assault Rifle. He uses the Assault Rifle on Infantry, and the Rocket Launcher for big jobs such as hostile Air Units or Vehicles. He can also hop in friendly Vehicles, but not hijack hostile ones. Rusk can bring inspiration to the Battlefield, fighting along side other ODST as Marines; showing them what one ODST can do. Brave Team Support Ashen Team These ODST don't mess around. This squad is known as Ashem Team, a tough squad armed to the teeth. Major Veil use a Magnum, Pierce weilding a Silenced SMG, Vance holds a Silenced SMG, Katarn uses a Rocket Launcher, and Able is armed with a Sniper Rifle. They are also equipped with a Target Locator. This special tool can call a Orbital Mac Blast down on any hostile units targeted with the ability. Elite ODST New Mombasa ODST Arctics [2v2] High Crash Chance. The UNSC once had full control of this region, until the Covenant assaulted and caused much damage to the area. Fight in this arctic wasteland for control of various power points and reclaim the outposts throughout the area. Destroyed Building Deconstruct this building to build a Building Socket here, and construct a fence along with it to reclaim this area. You'll also be able to furtherly be able to expand by additionally purchasing a Turret Socket with various upgrades to enhance the Turret. The Socket will allow you to create a Supply Pad, Heavy Supply Pad, Reactor, Field of Armory, Barracks, Spartan Barracks, Vehicle Depot, or an Airpad. Request a special squad of Marines from the Spirit of Fire from this Landing Pad. This squad consist of 4 Marines with Assault Rifles, 2 with Battle Rifles and 2 with Rocket Launchers. These Marines arn't effected by the main upgades, excluding the Special Infantry Training upgrade. Marine Squad Hawk and Warthog Request a Warthog and a Hawk together as one to scout or fight foes together. This unique combo of units can only be trained here, and may serve to be useful. The Warthog must be upgraded for offensive measures. Destroyed Landing Pad Clean up the area and repair this snowy Landing Pad to request units from the Spirit of Fire. Some units are exclusive to this Landing Pad only, while others are at a discounted cost. New Mombasa Jetpack ODST This squad of 3 ODST weilding Rocket Launchers are also equipped with a special Jetpack. These specially trained ODST can pack a punch and flee if necessary. Special ODST Becker Abagale Von Becker is a fresh recruit forced into service due to the war. She is very inexperienced in combat but she will help where she can. She can be commanded to patch up other infantry units and can collect supplies extremely quickly. Though seemly cowardly; she has quite the fighting spirit and can gain veterancy faster then most units. Scope Purchasing this upgrade will allow the Marine Commando team to use a Sniper Rifle to attack Infantry from a distance. Marine Commando Squad Marine Commandos are special Marines that have been through intense training, making them better than your average Marines. Through various upgrades they can utilize stronger weapons and become even tougher. Special Marines Explosive Kit This upgrade will allow you to command the Marine Commando team to use Grenade Launchers to destroy enemy Vehicles, and Rocket Launchers against hostile Air Units. Durable Shield Marine Commandos will have an upgraded suit if you choose to research this upgrade. They'll now have an Energy Shield that protects them from any incoming damage. Once the Shield depletes, the Marine Commandos will be vulnerable to damage. First Aid Kit Becker can aquire some better tools to heal choosing this to research. She can heal all unit types and heal faster than before. Special Plates Researching this will upgrade Becker's armor with specialized plates that can reflect some of the projectiles back to the attacker. Field Promotion Becker gets a field promotion and becomes a Marine Commando greatly increasing her offensive capabilities. (Requires Combat Shielding upgrade from Marine Commandos.) Engine Upgrade Upgrade the Sliverback's Engines to increase the speed of the Scout Vehicle. This will also increase it's Damage and Hitpoints. Grenade Launcher Upgrading the Sliverback again will provide is with a Grenade Launcher as another offensive measure, most effective against Buildings and Vehicles. It will also furtherly increase it's Damage and Hitpoints. Cannon Upgrade This upgrades the Sliverback's Cannon to having four barrels instead of it's current two, firing twice as fast. It will also upgrade it's Damage and Hitpoints one final time. Ashen Team Training Special Training makes Ashen Team members better, having more Hitpoints and deal more Damage. Through more upgrades they'll become stronger. Target Locator Cooldown Purchasing this upgrade will reduce the recharge time of Ashen Team's Target Locator ability by 50%. You'll be able to call Orbital Mac Blasts much faster, devestating those who dare to stand in the way of Ashen Team. They'll also have more Hitpoints and deal more Damage. Extra Special Training More training for Ashen Team to be able to deal more Damage and increase their Hitpoints. It will also upgrade the Orbital Mac Blast ability as well, dealing more damage. Ecodemy Buildings Move over to the Ecodemy Buildings menu. This will have a quality selection from buildings to generate supplies, hold more population or even Building Socket choices. Offensive Buildings Head to the first menu that allows you to construct Offensive Buildings for a price. Turrets, UNSC Anti-Aircraft Batteries, Shields, Mines and Explosive Barrels can be found here. Construct a Siren which will allow you to play a wide variety of music. From Combat OST for when your launching an attack or when your base under a heavy assault where music don't normally play to Ambient tracks if you desire to switch up the music in-game. Plays OST Base Turret [Foundation] This Turret can be built anywhere, best around your single buildings if you decide to make a base anywhere. This Turret comes with Foundation around it, making it look fancier. You can also enhance your main base defense with these. If the Turret is destroyed, you will have to create a new one. You are allowed to deploy a Tatical Turret when attacking enemy bases. This is the one build acceptable without being a cheater. If you have units attacking the base, you can command the Build-Hog to deploy and slowly build the turret during the attack. Otherwise, don't build turrets randomly in sneaky spots around enemy bases. Explosive Barrels Place down a stack of Explosive Barrels that can explode upon your command. You could set these up around corners, or anywhere hostiles are around to blow them sky high. Exploding the Barrels will cause area damage to all troops near it, including your own and friendlies. Rigged to Explode Ecodemy Building Menu Base Buildings Menu Airbase Outpost Socket Constructs the Outpost This premium option allows you to construct a small outpost here. This small Outpost is known as a UNSC Airbase, able to produce Air Units while serving as a small base. This includes an Airpad, 2 Building Sockets, 4 Turret Sockets, Hornets, Marines, Police and a Scorpion for defensive purpases. The Outpost itself will also be able to train it's own small selection of ground units. Marines, Rocket Launcher ODST, Rhinos, Gauss Warthogs, and Cyclopses can be trained from the main building. Alpha Base Construct a massive Outpost Base here known as Alpha Base. This over-sized Outpost is heavily defended with all sorts of unit around the square court-yard. From Grizzlies, Marines all the way up to Vultures defend this base while also including 8 Turret Sockets, 5 Supply Pads, a Special Infantry Barracks, a Vehicle Airlock, Radio Pelican, and the Main Base itself. The Main Base can train Marines, Arcadia Police, Marine Scouts, Badgers, Gremlins and Warthogs. This large base is best deployed in the largest area possible on the flattest of all surfaces. Reactor Menu Move over to the Reactor Menu where you'll be able to have a wide selection of different Reactors to build. From special Garrisonable Reactors with Fences, to the Spirit of Fire's massive Power Core for Ultimate Power. Specialized Reactors Menu Use this option to open the next menu that's got a nice selection of Buildings to build. Being able to build the Special Infantry Barracks, Vehicle Airlock, The UNSC Landing Pad, Command Centers, Decoy Forerunner Bases, and two fully customized outpost Bases; you'll be able to truly claim more land as yours with this menu's option. You can purchase a ONI Reactor from this menu and have it constructed here. This Reactor can provide Power if troops are garrisoned. Damaged Spirit of Fire Power Core Instantly build a Basic Reactor here, and it will Generate 1 Power. It can also be upgraded once, or allow you to build the Mobile Reactor, or lastly even Research Carpet Bombs. Build a Forerunner Reactor and it in front of the Build-Hog. You'll be able to garrison it with Infantry to Guard and claim this Reactor fully as yours. Basic Reactor Not Mobile Reactor You can purchase this Mobile Reactor, similar to the Mobile Reactor, other than it can't move. This stationary Reactor will grant you 1 Power as long as you can keep it out of harms way. Garrisonable Buildings Use this option to move over to the next Menu loaded with a wide variety of Garrisonable Buildings to Wreckages. Garrisonable Wreckages Menu Garrisonable Buildings Moving over to the next building you'll find more Garrisonables. These being Buildings, an ONI Watch Tower, a Arcadia Police Tower, a stolen Covenant Sniper Platform, and the wreckage of a Bus. Garrisonable Buildings Menu Garrisonable Wreckages Supply Office Construct a Supply Office at your will. This Office will generate supplies overtime, a bit more than a Supply Pad, but also less than the Generator; in the middle line. It may be upgraded once to produce 50% more supplies than it currently is able to overtime. Office Upgrade Upgrade this Supply Office to produce 50% more supplies than it currently can now. If you want more income, then this upgrade should suit your taste. Buildable Fence Build and Shape your own base with this discontinued choice. As it grew to be the most confusing thing in my life for this to work, it's discontinued as of now. However you can freely build fences in most directions. The first menu of the Fence and Fence Corners are named properly, but things after that are not, so beware it can get very confusing what you're building! If you pass those tough trails, you will indeed be able build fences in chosen directions, and you can use the Build-Hog for buildings! Customize your own base! Sun Devil and Mjolnir Scorpion Combo Deploy a Sun Devil and Mjolnir Scorpion for defensive measures. These 3 Units all working together will slow the enemy down while dealing decent damage back. Tank beats everything! Rhino and Wolverine Combo Delpoy 2 Rhinos and 2 Wolverines for a unique mix of units. They'll defend the Super Fortress with all their might. Gremlin Army Deploy 6 Gremlins that you can control to use their EMP Blast for shocking Vehicles. These long ranged attacks can come quite useful for defending the Super Fortress from hostile Vehicles. Camouflage Pumas now have the ability to Cloak. RESPONSE CANNONS The Puma's gauss cannons now turn faster and have increased accuracy. Summon a Squad of Hornets Summon 4 Hornets to defend the area in front of this Fence from hostile attackers after the Super Fortress. EMP Grenades ODSJTs now can fire EMP Grenades to stun vehicles briefly.(This Ability is shared with the Jetpack and shares it's cooldown time). COOLING SYSTEMS ODSJT's Jetpacks now have improved cooling systems greatly decreasing the time needed to recharge (Also decreases EMP Grenade cooldown time). Spartan Laser Replaces ODSJT's rocket launchers for Spartan Lasers. PULSE LASERS Upgrades the Mechwarriors Machine Gun Cannon into a Pulse Laser Cannon greatly increasing damage output. MORTAR LAUNCHER Adds the Mortar Launcher Ability. Using this ability locks the Mechwarrior in place and switches his weapon from the pulse cannons to the Mortar Launcher which deals effective damage against Vehicles and Buildings. (Moving cancels this effect. this effect does not have a cool-down and can be activated at any time.) MAXIMUM POWER Augments the Mechwarriors Cyclops weapon systems for it to reach Maximum Power. Greatly increasing its damage output, speed and defenses. Deflection Plating Special Plating for the Gunship Pelican will allow the Pelican to deflect some incoming Damage. Laser Beam Upgrades the Gunship Pelican to allow you to choose between the regular Gunship Pelican and another equipped with a dangerous Spartan Laser attack as it's primary weapon. Gunship Pelican Rocket Warthog MK2 The Rocket Warthog MK2 is the upgraded variant of the regular Rocket Warthog. This quick scout unit may look like the other one, but instead fires many more rockets per barrage, dealing much a decent amount of damage per strike. [Laser] The Gunship Pelican isn't a Pelican used for transport; instead it's transport features are replaced with offensive measures. Being equipped with a GUA-23/AW/Linkless Feed Autocannon that fires .50 BMG rounds, and a heavy-duty Spartan Laser cannon; this Aircraft can make a unique assault unit. Customize Aircraft Menu Use this option to move over to the next menu of the Airpad. This menu will allow you to customize your Air Units to your liking, choosing their weapon systems for the squad you desire. Customize Air Units Choose Weapon Systems Spartan Railgun This Spartan is equipped with a Railgun. This weapon takes a moment to charge up before unleashing a deadly explosive energy beam upon the target. The Railgun is most effective against Vehicles while it still can do decent damage against any unit type. Upgrades Menu Research Upgrades for Spartans Spartan Upgrades Open the next menu in the Spartan Barracks that consist of upgrades for all the Spartans other than Brave Team and Friends. Those upgrades may be researched through seperate upgrades. Trains Warthogs Cyclops Enforcer Dusk Cyrotroopers Cyrotroopers to the core, UNSC Flamethrowers with different weapons. They'll freeze the life out of any organic thing they can find. Cyrotroopers take the meaning of Chill Out to the next level with any hostiles. Cyclops Enforcer enforces pain to Vehicles. This Cyclops doesn't destory Buildings with mighty punches. Instead, he uses a Railgun to destroy enemy Vehicle targets. Dusk fights along side Brave Team, providing fire support for the team. Not much is known about them other than the fact that they only respond to orders given directly to them via their commander and no other. Trains Even More Infantry Transfer over to the next menu of this Barracks. This menu holds the Mech Warrior, Cyclops Enforcer, and Cyrotroopers. Summon Marines Deploy a squad of Marines to defend the Super Fortress from invaders. 2 Marines with Sniper Rifles, 4 Marines with Assault Rifles, and 2 Marines with Rocket Launcher will be on guard behind this Fence. All the Marines in the squad must fall before you can summon a new squad. Tatical Snipers Train some Tatical Snipers to shoot down enemies from long range with Sniper Rifles. These Snipers compared to the other's have fancy armor, and don't mess around on the battlefield. ODST from New Mombasa are here to join the fight! 3 ODST with Sub-Machines Guns, and 2 ODST with Shotguns are prepared for battle by your command. Haze Ice Shard Rounds Cyro Tech Advances Cryo Troopers can now release large amounts of Cryogenic air around them, damaging and stunning any infantry units near. Cryo Troopers can shoot shards of ice that greatly damages and stuns infantry. Advances in cryo technology grains Cryo Troopers Energy Shielding and greatly increases the amount of damage they deal against all unit types. Heavy Shield Cyclops Enforcers gain a giant side Shield which deflects projectiles. Seeker Missles Cyclops Enforcers can fire heat seeking missiles that lock on to vehicle and briefly stun them. Shockrounds Cyclops Enforcers now shoot Shock Rounds that greatly increases damage to vehicles while also slowing them down. Leader Powers Choose Wisely Pick Powers you desire, you can only choose one. Unlock the Mac Blast Power that takes up slot 7 on the Leader Power Wheel. You'll be able to only upgrade this Mac Blast only once, leaving you with two shots. Unlock the Cryo Bomb to freeze enemy units, taking up slot 7 on the Leader Power Wheel. You'll be able to upgrade the Cryo Bomb fully for maximum efficiency. Carpet Bombs Unlock Carpet Bombs to rain bombs on enemy units, taking up slot 7 on the Leader Power Wheel. You'll be able to upgrade the Carpet Bombs fully for maximum efficiency. Extra Shot Upgrade the Secondary Mac Blast Power to provide you with a extra shot, increasing the capacity by one. More Bombs Upgrade the Shortsword to hold more bombs within the bay, also increasing it's damage. Even More Bombs Upgrade the Shortsword to hold even more bombs within the bay, also increasing it's damage. Lots of Bombs Upgrade the Shortsword one final time to truly deliver hell from above. Big Cryo Bomb Upgrade the Cryo Bomb to freeze a larger area, making anything within temporarily frozen. Bigger Cryo Bomb Upgrade the Cryo Bomb again to furtherly freeze a larger area, making anything within temporarily frozen. Huge Cryo Bomb Upgrade the Cryo Bomb one last time to furtherly freeze a larger area, making anything within temporarily frozen. Orbital Rusk Drop Deploy Rusk from the Spirit of Fire, through an ODST Drop Pod. You'll be able to deploy him anywhere on the battlefield! Unlocks the Orbital Rusk Drop in the Leader Power Wheel. You'll be able to deploy him anywhere! This upgrade is located on slot 3 on the Leader Power Wheel. New Mombasa ODST Drop Deploy New Mombasa ODST from the Spirit of Fire, ready for action. Unlock the ability to drop New Mombasa ODST anywhere on the battlefield! This Power takes up slot 3 on the Leader Power Wheel. ODST Drops Using this Menu will open will provide you with various ODST Drops you may unlock. You can only choose one ODST Drop per game, so choose wisely! Only the first one you choose will be the chosen ODST Drop for the game, researching a second one would only drain supplies for no gain. Summon Hawks and Medical Pelican Request 2 Hawks to defend in front of this Fence to defend the Super Fortress, while the Medical Pelican hovers in the back for short-ranged repairs to the Hawks themselves; anything wounded/damaged near it. Alternate Arctics [2v2] Medium/High Crash Chance Fight in an alternate version of Arcics Request 4 Hawks to hover in front of this Fence to fortify the Super Fortress, and to keep eyes in the sky. Supportive Buildings Move over to the Supportive Buildings Menu. The Buildings here can allow you to upgrade your main Leader Power, or even research more Population. Supportive Buildings Summon New Mombasa ODST Call in a squad of New Mombasa ODST consisting of 4 with Sub-Machine Guns, 2 with Shotguns and 4 wiedling Rocket Launchers on the left and right of this Fence. They'll defend the Super Fortress from any attackers nearby. Construct a Supply Office [Supply Office or Building Socket] Build a Supply Office Building Beacon instead of a extra building Socket for 400 Resources. Located on the right of Ander's Research Tower, and the Support Center. If fully constructed at the cost of 1000 and 1 Tech, the Supply Office can be upgraded once to furtherly generate more income. At full capacity this will generate almost twice as much as a regular Supply Pad! Build a Supply Office on top of this Building Beacon to enhance your income. It may be upgraded once to produce even more Supplies. Summon Railgun Spartans Request 3 Railgun Spartans, 2 Chaingun Spartans, 4 New Mombasa ODST with Sub-Machine Guns, and 1 with a Shotgun to defend the Super Fortress from invaders. They'll be on the left and right of this Fence. Build A Special Reactor [Unsc/Oni Reactor or Building Socket] Construct a second Special Reactor Building Beacon on the left of the Maintenance Tower, or a Building Socket. You may only choose one of these options to customize your Super Fortress. To fully construct the Reactor would cost 1250 Resources. Deploy 2 Mjolnir Scorpions on the left and right of this Fence to defend the Super Fortress. They'll stay in place to ward off any attackers, giving all they got until they fall. Deploy Mjolnir Scorpions Construct a Turret behind this Fence, watching for any hostiles to fire upon. It will defend the Super Fortress, and cannot be upgraded. Deploy Pumas Command 2 Pumas to drive up on the left and right of this Fence. They'll defend the Base against hostile forces. Pumas are more known for being put up against Vehicles, as they are an Anti-Vehicle unit themselves. Yet another destroyed Fence, doesn't seem like it provides much use at the moment. Investing 200 Resources into this special Fence will allow you to request various Nutritious Edition troops combinations; requesting units that don't take up population nor be controlled to defend the Super Fortress. Devoted to Nutritious Edition. Nutritious Edition Fence A destroyed Fence sits here. It can be repaired and fully constructed with 350 Resources. It will allow you to deploy various troop combinations that don't take up population or be controlled. They'll defend the Super Fortress with all they got if they're in range. Summon Gunship Pelicans Request 2 Gunship Pelicans that fire lasers, hovering on the left and right of this Fence for supportive Aerial Defense. Summon Mjolnir Vultures Also known as Vulture MK2s. Summon 2 Mjolnir Vultures to hover on the left and right of this Fence, two menacing beast on a stationery mission to blow any suckers up who think they can take them. These two Vultures are specially setup to allow you to control their Mega Barrage for all that more firepower. Nutritious Edition Fence Special Garbage Can Repairs the Supply Office Repair the Supply Office This option will build another Supply Office Building Beacon incase the previous Supply Office has been destroyed. Deploy Sun Devils Two stationery Sun Devils will be in front of this Fence to defend against any sort of hostiles. As they can deal decent Damage against any units, they'll be the most effective against Air Types. Summon Wolverines Deploy Two Wolverines in front of this Fence. Wolverines are best put up against Air Units, unlike Sun Devils which can deal decent damage against any unit type. Regardless, these two Wolverines will defend the Super Fortress at all cost. Deploy Sliverbacks Command 3 Sliverbacks to park in front of this Fence, stationery for one purpase: defending the Super Fortress. These Sliverbacks will slow down the enemy while dealing moderate Damage back. Summon Marine Commandos Have a Squad of Marine Commandos on the left of this Fence. This consist of 4 Marine Commandos with Shotguns, 2 ODSJT with Rocket Launchers, and 2 Marines with Sniper Rifles. Hornet Hawk Combo Summon two Hornets and one Hawk above this Fence, able to Guard the Super Fortress from invaders. They'll hover in place for the one and only purpase of defending, while not taking population nor be selected. Hornet [No Wingmen] Hornets are the main UNSC Air Unit, while this Hornet in particular doesn't have Wingmen. They come armed with Gatling cannons and explosive rockets giving them more than adequate offense against most any enemy. Hornets are the main UNSC Air Unit, while this Hornet has a fancy light on the front of the vehicle. They come armed with Gatling cannons and explosive rockets giving them more than adequate offense against most any enemy. Chaingun Hawk The Hawk is the main airial assault unit, also the upgraded version of a Hornet. This flying vehicle is equipped only with duel Machine Guns on the wings. The Chaingun Hawk deals accelerated Damage against enemy Infantry. Rocket Hawk The Hawk is the main airial assault unit, also the upgraded version of a Hornet. This flying vehicle is equipped with duel Machine Guns on the wings and an explosive Rocket Attack. The Rocket Hawk deals accelerated Damage against enemy Vehicles. Summon 3 Defensive Hawks above this Fence. They'll stay in place and defend the Super Fortress from any attackers. Biggest Spartan Army With enough Tech, and Resources; You can surprisingly have yet one more Spartan to add to your army. The previous Spartan Population Upgrades must be Researched first before this will be available. You'll conquer the world with your mighty army! Your army is massive! Mightiest Army Upgrade the maximum count of your main unit population one final time, another five will be added. You'll have the roughest and toughest military around! Upgrades the weapon systems on the Rocket Warthog, allowing it to fire many more rockets than before. This upgrade in specific will also increase the Vehicles Hitpoints and Damage lightly. The Build-Hog trainable from the Command Center can construct about anything you could ever want. Being able to build anywhere doesn't come cheap. Build-Hog Special Building Menu Base Building FTL Core Mobile Reactor A UNSC Power Core, that can power an entire vessel just like the Spirit of Fire. This can be built, and serve as one Reactor. This unique Reactor can also be tugged by an Elephant made from your Command Center or the UNSC Landing Pad. This Generator Array doesn't look salvageable, you can scrap it to expand your base by having the area clear to build a UNSC Landing Pad here. This building will allow you to request special Vehicles. Badgers, Rhinos, Sun Devils, Wolverines, Cobras, and Gremlins. This powerful weapon can be used at long range; most effectively against Infantry units. This Spartan has also played a role in the UNSC Air Force. This building can train Protecters and Sentinels, the Protecters can be used to modify your units. You can also garrison Vehicles inside this building to protect them, while also being able to access the Spirit of Fire Vehicle Airlock which trains Hornets, Gremlins, and Wolverines. You can expand your base by building a Special Infantry Barracks on this Beacon. Here, you will be able to train Arcadia Police, Flame Throwers, Cyclopses, Marine Grenadiers, Marine Shotgunners, Marine Snipers, and a special squad of Orbital Shock Drop Troopers. Mark Two Sentinels get increased health and damage. This can help them fight enemy forces without being destroyed as easily. Red Team Spartans can hijack enemy vehicles much quicker and use any vehicles more effectively. This could reduce the amount of enemy vehicles during an attack, and turn them around to fight back easier. Red Team Spartans will now have a very light Shield upgrade, and Damage increase. This upgrade can help increase their survivability in combat. Extra Training Superior Spartan Training will put Spartans through a few training classes. This is effective against all types of units, hell from above! Assault Marines Spartan - Battle Rifle This Spartan is unlike the others, he weilds a Battle Rifle; not the strongest unlike a Spartan Laser. This Spartan's rank is just above ODST. Anders has spread her powerful tech for all to use, for a more expensive price. Spirit of Fire - Anders "Nothing ventured, nothing gained." Professer Anders is assigned to the Spirit of Fire, a large heavily modified UNSC Colony Ship. Anders is here to help the fight by repairing vehicles and documenting the area for her studies. She isn't ment for combat, only for research. Captain Cutter has allowed her to take part on the surface of Harvest to relieve from being in the Spirit of Fire's Research Bay constantly. Spirit of Fire - Sgt. Forge "Son, I've a feeling before this is over, we'll need every last Spartan in the fight. I can do this. Report back to the ship." Sgt. Forge is assigned to the Spirit of Fire, a large heavily modified UNSC Colony Ship. Captain Cutter has given Sgt. Forge permission to fight on the ground in his Warthog, and fight the hostile forces. This Warthog is equipped with Sgt. Forge on a Guass Turret, a Grenader in the passanger seat and a single driver; this vehicle makes a decent scout unit that can defend itself. Keep an eye out for them will you? I made a few improvements. My own special upgrades... Those Grunts are carrying explosives - look out! Hacking... Serina, we need to reestablish Alpha Base before we can proceed with the mission. The base is up and running again. We need supply pads built so I can send down materials. State of Grace Increases repair rate. Harmonious Digestion Increases movement speed. Forerunner Shield Augmented with even more repurposed Forerunner technology, all Covenant shields now recharge much faster. Ghastly Vision The Arbiter becomes permanently cloaked and increases reflected damage even more. Defiant Rage Health is restored every time the Arbiter inflicts a fatality in Rage Mode. Eradicator Eradicator description Anti-Flood unit Scattered pockets of Marines are isolated and under attack near Alpha Base. Locate as many as you can and kill the Covenant forces that are attacking them; the Marines will be needed to retake Alpha Base. The Covenant have erected an energy barrier across the pass leading to Alpha Base. The barrier will block vehicles, but Marines can move through and destroy the power source beyond. Alpha Base is the key UNSC installation on Harvest. Covenant forces have completely overrun the facility. Defeating the Covenant units in the area is a top priority. Grunts, called Unggoy in the Covenant language, are cowardly but dangerous in large numbers. Methane breathers, they are commonly seen in Covenant infantry squads. Counter them with your own infantry, or with Flamethrowers. The Covenant attack has heavily damaged Alpha Base. Get it back up and running by building Supply Pads and military buildings. A Supply Pad is a key component of any military base. Stockpiling supplies will let us build additional structures and train military forces. A Barracks at Alpha Base will allow military units to be trained there. With enough boots on the ground, Alpha Base will be safe once more. After the Marines are trained, patrols can be sent out and the surrounding area secured. The structure is north of Alpha Base, past the Covenant forces. You will have to fight your way through enemy forces to get there. The Covenant were after the secrets buried in the Forerunner structure. Enter and learn what you can. The Covenant are planning to destroy the Forerunner structure. Take out the detonator. Jackals are birdlike aliens who serve as Covenant scouts and sharpshooters. Lacking durability, they often carry energy shields. Counter them with armed Warthogs or Flamethrowers. The Covenant are refining methane on Harvest to supply their Grunt squads. Taking out the refinery would slow them down. Several UNSC units are trapped. Rescue them to bolster your forces. Anders will need time to activate the hardlight bridge. Keep the Covenant forces at bay until she succeeds. Get Forge and Anders to the exit. The Covenant will overwhelm you if you wait too long. Anders may still be able to activate the second bridge and give the UNSC forces a chance to escape. It is vital that Anders returns to Spirit of Fire with the information from the Forerunner structure. Get her and Forge to the landing zone ASAP. Forge and his troops can only hold off the Covenant for so long. They will need support, rescue, and extraction. Deactivating the bridge will drop any units trying to cross it into the chasm below. Use this information to your advantage. Hunters are collective colonies of small creatures packed into assault armor. Strong and fast, and typically travelling in pairs, Hunters are used to destroy enemy vehicles. Counter them with infantry or air power. Eliminate the Covenant forces around the subway exit so the civilians have a clear path to the transports. The civilians will head toward the transports on their own. At least one of the transport ships must survive; the city's population has no other way to evacuate the area. A base in the city will let you train more units to protect the civilians and transports. If you can assemble enough of a force, it might even be possible to launch a limited counterattack against the Covenant. Elites, also known as Sangheili, are often seen leading Covenant forces into battle. Using their cloaks and energy swords to surprise and overwhelm their enemies, Elites are challenging opponents. Covenant forces are swarming all over the crater. Take out all the enemies and create a safe zone. Additional UNSC forces are on approach to your location. The crater is excellent defensive terrain; hold fast, maintain a base in the crater, and wait for help. Covenant forces are closing in. Get to the southern crater and try to hold out. If the Covenant base is destroyed, the UNSC position on Arcadia will be secure. All of the base buildings and any nearby Covenant units must be eliminated. More production capacity would give you a fighting chance to defeat the Covenant. If the crater is secure, try to claim an additional base. The Wraith is a heavy vehicle equipped with a plasma mortar. Used at the forefront of ground assaults, they are a critical component of the Covenant arsenal. Counter them with Cobras. The Covenant are attacking in force. Fight off the assault. You will need to get several Rhinos in position to be able to bring enough firepower to bear on the dome. Rhinos will be dropped at the landing pad. Positions for the Rhinos are marked. Protect each Rhino until it can safely deploy at the marked destination. The Spirit of Fire menu has an option that allows you to use Pelicans to transport Rhinos. The Rhinos are all in position. Wipe out the enemy structures and bring down the dome. A fast-moving flying unit, the Banshee is highly maneuverable. Equipped with plasma cannon, it provides deadly and effective air support for Covenant forces. Counter Banshees with Wolverines. Taking control of the nearby ONI Reactors will let you train advanced troops more quickly. The Scarab must be destroyed before it wipes out your base. Keep your forces out of the head's line of fire. The nodes are secondary power sources for the Scarab. If they are destroyed, the Scarab will not be able to turn its head as quickly. The spider-like Locust is slow-moving but powerful. It is designed to destroy structures, and is less effective against units. Counter the Locust with Marines or Scorpions. Spirit's forces must secure the marked location for a base. This planet's atmosphere is highly unusual; use caution and stay alert for signs of trouble. The Elephant is a fully equipped mobile training center. Once deployed, it can mobilize infantry and serve as a forward base. The Elephants are extremely valuable military hardware and must be retrieved at all costs. Send your forces out to recover them. The first stage of a mysterious alien life form, it is highly aggressive and dangerous. The infection forms attempt to penetrate the spinal cords of their victims. They can be countered by massed fire from virtually any military unit. The Spartans have gone ahead, following Anders' signal. Link up with them and reinforce their position before it's too late. Anders' signal is up ahead. Send patrols forward to locate and rescue her. Data analysis suggests that killing the pods should weaken the larger infection form. Taking out as many pods as possible is the safest tactical approach. Once enough of the pods are destroyed, the primary infection should be engaged. Use caution - even after it has been weakened, it is still an extremely dangerous opponent. These alien lifeforms are possibly providing nutrients to the smaller infection variants. They are easily destroyed by any unit. Alpha, Bravo, Charlie and Air Team platoons have been cut off beyond the areas overrun by the Flood. Your soldiers will have to clear a path through the Flood and bring them back to the LZ. Air Team can handle themselves with your support. Escort the platoon back through the Flood-infested areas. Watch out for any infection forms and keep them away from your infantry. A Gremlin may be able to temporarily disrupt the pylons and delay the automatic docking procedure. In theory, this should buy Spirit of Fire more time. Optional: Kill 350 Swarms UNSC weapons can damage, but not completely destroy, the alien structures. Only the tunnel's technology can permanently clear the forms off Spirit's hull. The Flood must not be allowed to breach the airlocks. If the airlocks are destroyed, we will not be able to send reinforcements and the Flood may move in between the outer and inner hulls of the Spirit of Fire. Train troops from your Command Center; ensure that no units or obstacles are in front of the base or units may get stuck inside the base. Flood structures have attached themselves to the outside of Spirit of Fire's hull, and are threatening to break through the airlocks. Destroy them all before they infect the ship. The airlocks provide some cover for our infantry. Order them inside. Controlled by some sort of A.I., these small high-tech constructions appear to be designed to contain the infection forms. Counter them with any military unit. We're almost out - the exit is in sight. That thing is blocking our escape. Take it down, and bring us up to flank speed. We'll leave these drones behind us. Serina, maximum power to the engines. Get us out of here! The ring is helping clear the infestation from the hull. We just have to hold those aliens off until it can clean the ship. Bad news. I intercepted a signal from the alien A.I. Those drones have declared us a threat and are massing behind us. Something big is coming... Take cover! What the...get in the airlocks or we're all dead! The ring is back! Take cover - another cleansing wave is coming. All clear - the hull is clean. Decontamination sequence commencing. FORERUNNER RELIC FORERUNNER RELIC Opens Containment Unit A Covenant base is between our forces and our primary objective. Destroying it will secure the path to the Forerunner structure. We noticed a few colony creatures on the way in. We can weaken the big one by taking them out first. Uploading coordinates. I've lost Anders' transponder - could the creature be jamming the signal? Flood Stalk Flood Egg Stalk Description The energy field is reacting to the aliens - it's trying to clean our hull. Take cover out there! SHIELD Shield description A.I. Advisor Toggles the A.I. Crate Light post Learn Gathering Learn Building Learn Training Learn Upgrading Learn Attacking Learn Powers Sergeant Forge rallied several squads of marines and drove the Covenant forces out of Alpha Base. Having rebuilt Alpha Base and fought their way through to the relic, Sergeant Forge and his men arrived just in time to stop Covenant forces from destroying it. With the help of the Grizzly tanks, Forge and Anders fought their way past Covenant forces and out of the relic. Though there were many casualties, several large transports carrying refugees managed to escape from Arcadia thanks to Spirit of Fire's forces. After retreating from the city to a large crater, Forge and his men rallied and counterattacked, destroying a Covenant base. Strategic placement of Spirit of Fire's Rhinos helped bring down the Covenant energy dome. A Covenant super weapon is now vulnerable to attack. The Covenant's efforts to complete the construction of a Super Scarab ended in failure. UNSC forces got the job done, eliminating a major threat. Several lost Elephants and ODST squads were recovered, and Spirit's ground forces engaged a mysterious alien life form. Anders' transponder signal was a fake generated by the alien hive mind. After a difficult fight, UNSC forces successfully destroyed the creature. With time running out, most of Spirit's ground forces successfully returned to the ship before it was drawn inside the strange world. As alien life forms swarmed all over Spirit of Fire's hull, the Marines made a desperate but ultimately successful stand at the hatches and airlocks. After the collision with the Covenant destroyer, Spirit's crew managed to repair the ship and disengage. Professor Anders was finally rescued and made it to the landing zone for extraction. Using Elephants to drag the reactor core to the top of the Apex, Spirit's crew got the core in position to detonate and hopefully destroy the Shield World. Though many good soldiers fell in battle, Spirit of Fire's crew opened the Forerunner structure's doors and escaped from the interior of the Shield World. $$BACK$$ All objectives have objective details. Build a Supply Pad Sergeant Forge, rendezvous with RED Team and find Anders, but be careful - we don't know what these things are capable of. Captain Cutter reflects on the events that bring Spirit of Fire to Harvest. Sergeant Forge reports that the Covenant are still on the planet surface. Sergeant Forge makes a startling discovery while Professor Anders prepares to go down to the surface of the planet.Meanwhile, the Arbiter is ordered to destroy the Forerunner installation. Professor Anders and Sergeant Forge activate the Forerunner installation. The information from Harvest points the crew of Spirit of Fire towards Arcadia, another UNSC colony world.When Spirit of Fire arrives, the world is already under attack by the Covenant. The Arbiter is ordered to capture Professor Anders. The Covenant have built a shield on the surface of Arcadia and the crew debate how to find out what they are hiding. Professor Anders is kidnapped by the Covenant. Spirit of Fire pursues her kidnappers deep into enemy space. Serina accidently unlocks the secret of the Shield World and opens the entrance portal, dragging Spirit of Fire inside the planet. The entrance to the Shield World closes behind Spirit of Fire while the ship descends deep into the planet. Spirit of Fire enters the interior of the Shield World and collides with a Covenant destroyer. Professor Anders is forced to unlock the Forerunner dreadnaught ships and escapes to the surface. The crew decides to detonate their FTL reactor in order to stop the Covenant from using the Forerunner dreadnaughts. In a final confrontation between the Arbiter and Sergeant Forge, the reactor is damaged and one of the crew must make the ultimate sacrifice. Spirit of Fire narrowly escapes from the exploding Shield World. Professor Anders enters cryo sleep under protest. In Halo Wars, you (the player) are in control of single units, as well as large armies. You can give those units simple orders to move, attack, or use their special abilities. Ultimately, your goal is to use your units and armies to complete objectives and win scenarios. Bases in Halo Wars are very important to your success. You choose which buildings you want to build and upgrade at your base. Buildings at your base can be used to train and upgrade units, creating powerful armies to fight the enemy. But don't forget - the enemy is doing the same thing and it's all happening in real time. The ship Spirit of Fire is always in orbit above the planet. The ship's special powers can be called upon to get out of sticky situations. As you progress through the campaign, check this menu to see which powers are available to you. Some of the powers at your fingertips will include Heal and Repair, Carpet Bombing, and a giant MAC Cannon blast. The areas of the map that are black or foggy are places you either have not been or do not have line of sight. You can select and move your units into these areas to obtain line of sight. Remember, the black map goes away if you have been there but the fog of war remains unless one of your units has line of sight to the area. Spirit of Fire was heavily damaged in the collision. The power center must be repaired and brought back online before the ship can disengage. A Spirit is the Covenant dropship, used for transporting infantry and support troops. Spirits carry groups of Covenant units to battle. The deck guns are helping to hold back the Covenant assault. Keep as many as possible intact. Professor Anders must be rescued. Push forward and secure the landing zone. The initial LZ is not secure. A safer, alternative LZ might be found beyond the teleporter. Hold the landing zone at all costs. If your forces are overrun, all hope is lost. The Scarab is a powerful Covenant super weapon. If captured, it would provide much-needed support for our forces. Only Spartans are capable of capturing the Scarab. The alien bomber forms are a threat to our ground forces. Counter them with Wolverines. If Spirit of Fire is going to escape from the Forerunner structure, the door must be opened. The unlocking mechanism appears to be some sort of giant puzzle. A heavily armored walker designed to smash through enemy armies, the Scarab is a nearly unstoppable killing machine. If one appears on the battlefield, the best counters are Scorpions and Cobras. Ultimately, your goal is to use your units and armies to complete objectives and win scenarios. Bases in Halo Wars Bases in Halo Wars are very important to your success. If they can be activated in the correct sequence, the portal door sections may open. Scarabs Destroyed: Interlock Node Activated Area cleared Portal opened Welcome to the Halo Wars tutorial. It will teach you the basic commands and controls used to play Halo Wars. Let's start with controlling the camera so you can find your way around the map. You will simply move the $$LS$$ in the direction you want the camera to go. See if you can move the camera to the three flares that the blue objective arrow points to. Great! Now let's learn how to select your units. You will use what you learned about controlling the camera to center the crosshair in the middle of the screen over what you want to select. Perfect! Now you have a unit selected and you can see the unit type at the bottom of the screen. Let's issue a move order to the next smoke flare you see. Just move the crosshair to where you want the unit to go and press $$X$$. Notice that as your units move to new places on the map, the dark or fogged-over areas get revealed. Good! Just keep following the blue objective arrow. You now have more units to control. Select them all. You can do this by pressing the $$LB$$. Good! Now, using what you learned to move one unit, let's move all of these units. Move the crosshair to where you want to go, then press $$X$$. Keep following the blue objective arrow to the last target. We need to get through that Covenant shield. Let's order our army to attack the power source. Just like you did when you moved your units, select your units and move the crosshair over what you want to attack. Then press $$X$$. The shield is down! Follow the blue objective arrow and practice attacking some other targets. Remember, however, that some enemy targets in Halo Wars can fight back. These last targets seem much stronger. Luckily, some units in Halo Wars have special abilities. Try attacking this target using the $$Y$$ button instead of the $$X$$ button. Excellent! This ends the basic controls tutorial for Halo Wars. For more advanced controls, try playing the advanced tutorial. OPEN LOBBY FRIENDS ONLY INVITE ONLY XBOX LIVE: %1!s! AI Player Found player Searching for player Press $$Y$$ to use Ram attack Welcome to the Halo Wars advanced tutorial. We will cover more advanced concepts that you can use to play Halo Wars. Select the Warthog, then follow the blue objective arrow to the first target. Good! Let's start with the Warthog's Ram ability. Nice! Keep following the objective arrow and ram another target. In Halo Wars you are going to need supplies to buy and upgrade things. There are a few ways to get supplies. The first one we are going to learn is gathering supplies from crates. Follow the objective arrow to the next location. Gathering from crates increases your supplies. The amount of supplies you have is shown in the top right corner, next to the small crate icon. Okay - let's gather these crates. Just move the crosshair over them and press $$X$$. Good! Now that we have some supplies we can start building some things at our base. Move the camera back to the UNSC base. Select the marked building site. Using $$LS$$, push and hold to highlight the Supply Pad, then press $$A$$ to begin building it. A Supply Pad is another way to get supplies. Go ahead and build a second Supply Pad so your supplies are coming in at a steady pace. Now your supplies should be coming in at a good rate. With all these supplies we are ready to start building an army, but we will need a Barracks first. Select a building site and build a Barracks. Good! Now we can start training an army. Select the Barracks and train five Marine Squads. You can queue up more than one Marine squad at a time by selecting them in the circle menu and pressing $$A$$ five times. Excellent! If you pan the camera to the front of your base you will see your army. Now let's upgrade your army to make them more powerful. To do this we will need to select a building site and build a Reactor. Notice that you now have a number one by the small lightning bolt icon in the top right corner above your supply number. This is how many Reactors you have. Remember, as you increase your Reactor count, more units become available for you to train and upgrade. Having one Reactor will allow you to upgrade those Marines. Select the barracks and upgrade your Marines with the New Blood technology. Good! Now your Marines are upgraded. Let's follow the objective arrow and learn about Leader Powers. The Covenant has been kind enough to stand here while we practice using some of the Leader Powers. Lets start with a UNSC MAC blast. Press up on $$DPAD$$ to see the Leader Power menu. Now select the MAC Blast and let's blow up some stuff. We'll keep giving you additional MAC Blast shots, so just have fun until all the Wraiths are destroyed. Great! Now that you've learned to command the UNSC, we're going to jump over and show you how to lead the Covenant. The Covenant Leader Powers are different than the UNSC Leader Powers because they are treated like the Leader's $$Y$$ ability. The Prophet of Regret is trapped. Using his Cleansing Leader Power you will be able to free him. Select the Prophet and use his $$Y$$ ability to destroy the three power sources. Once you press $$Y$$ the power will begin and stay on screen. Then, using $$LS$$, steer the Cleansing beam around to the three Power Sources to destroy them. Free at last! To learn some more advanced features of Covenant upgrading we are going to jump to a Covenant base. Just press left on $$DPAD$$ to do this now. The Covenant base may look very different from the UNSC base but it works in a similar way. Select the building site and build a Factory. There are some powerful units that can be trained in the Factory but we need to upgrade the tech level before we can train some of them. Unlike the UNSC building Reactors to upgrade Tech Level, the Covenant upgrade Tech Level by researching Ages. Select the Temple and upgrade to the Age of Doubt. The Covenant can also research strong defenses. Select a building site and build a Shield Generator. As you can see, a shield has appeared around this base. Now it's time for an army! Select the Factory and train four Locusts. As your new Locusts train, send them into the Hot Drop Pad. They will instantly teleport to wherever your Covenant Leader is on the map. To quickly jump to your leader you can press up on $$DPAD$$. Excellent! Now select your Covenant army and go destroy the UNSC army nearby. Congratulations! You have successfully completed the Halo Wars advanced tutorial! You are ready to take on the universe! Basic Tutorial Advanced Tutorial CYCLE FILTER SQUADS BUILT (LOST) SQUADS KILLED BUILDINGS BUILT (LOST) BUILDINGS KILLED COMBAT EFFICIENCY SUPPLIES CRATES MAX BASES MAX TECH LEVEL TECHS RESEARCHED BASE SCORE BONUS TOTAL PLACE There are several ways to select units. If your crosshair is over a unit, press A to select it. To move a unit, select it, move the crosshair to where you want it to go, and press X. To select all the units, press LB. You can also "paint" a selection by holding down A and moving LS. To move multiple units, select them, move the crosshair to where you want them to go, and press X. To move the camera around the battlefield, simply move LS. To attack, select units, move the crosshair over the enemy you wish to attack with LS, then press X. To improve your technology, you will need Reactors to improve your technology level. Upgrades are always on the left side of a building's circle menu. To train units, select a building, use LS to select the unit you wish to train, then press A to train a unit. Press A multiple times to queue up additional units. Press UP on DPAD to see the Leader Power menu. Select the power using the LS, then press A to select the power. You will then need to target the power where you want to use it - in this case, on enemy Wraiths and other units. To order units to gather supplies from supply crates, select the units, move the crosshair over the crates, and press X. The Covenant need to research Ages at their Temple in order to increase their technology level. The Hot Drop Pad allows Covenant units to teleport to your Leader. Select Covenant units and send them into the Hot Drop Pad. Cleansing is the Prophet's unique ability. Select the Prophet and press Y to start cleansing. Steer the cleansing beam with LS. To construct a building, select an empty building site at the base and press A. Then select the building you wish to construct with LS and press A again to start construction. To use a unit's special ability instead of its normal attack, select the unit, target an enemy, and press $$Y$$. Use special abilities, standard attacks, and leader powers to destroy all enemy units.
